characters: UNDERGROUND BLAST SHEDS LIGHT ON SECRET GOVERNMENT
BLAST SURVIVORS BACK AT WORK, HOPE TO RESUME FUEL PROJECT
CONFESSION IMPLICATES OFFICIAL KILLED IN UNDERGROUND
PROBE ROLE OF ADVISORY COMMITTEE ON TECHNOLOGY AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of huge blast furnaces, rusting and abandoned. Eddie steers the motorcycle past them to the one small island of life - a few cars parked at the edge of a vast empty lot - and pulls to a stop. He gets off, splashes across the lot toward the mill entrance. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ordinary mill: it's been converted into a high tech lab, holding tanks, mainframe computers, experimental devices. A dozen TECHNICIANS are at work, drawn from across the world - brown, yellow, black, white skins ina casual mix and comfortable style that belies the high seriousness of purpose in the lab.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: nods as he passes techies at work in cubicles, stops at an office, reaches into his coat and draws out a comic  book, slides it onto the desk of CHEN, about forty. Chen looks up from his work:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: New Spawn?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Just out. He continues down the hall, nearly running over LILY NAUGHTON, roughly Eddie's age. She's wearing a lab coat over her jeans, the kind of woman who would be stunning if she took even a minute to think about it, which she doesn't. Mostly she thinks about her work (she runs the lab as Chen's assistant), and when she isn't thinking about that, she thinks about the long backpacking trips she wishes she had more time to take.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you have the new nozzle?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Right here. He sets his pack down, begins rummaging through it.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do we have a computer model?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Not yet. This doesn't make her happy:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You'll have to make one. We're testing at four thirty.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I haven't had time...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Make time. We're not going to test without the model. Haven't we gone through this before? Eddie pulls the new nozzle from his pack. But when he proudly raises it for Lily to inspect, she's already gone, moving down the hall. He says, to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) ...It was a hand job.

dialogues.speaker: LAB AREA
dialogues.text: Lily and Chen stand before the console. Chen speaks into a microphone in thickly accented English:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Okay, data recorders and confirm. A row of green lights illuminate one by one on the console. The TV monitors flicker, then images of the lab's machinery appear on various screens.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) Main stage pressure, forty five sixty by the mark. Fire and safety lines to condition "A". Chen glances over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) We have a green board.

dialogues.speaker: LAB AREA
dialogues.text: empty. Small jets spray water into the tank and it begins to fill. The wavery image of Ernest Bucholtz (BUCKY) appears through the water. He's nearing seventy, a grand old eccentric man of science in rumpled tweeds, drawing peanuts from one pocket of his coat, munching absent mindedly and dropping the shells in the other.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Let's begin. He turns toward Chen and Lily, waves an imaginary baton, as if he were leading an orchestra.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Main power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing near a bank of capacitors, throws a switch. The building begins to hum.

dialogues.speaker: TANK
dialogues.text: Small bubbles appear at the edges of the electrodes ringing the tank.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Injector... A techie throws a switch as Eddie peers closely at the injector he's recently installed.

dialogues.speaker: TUBES
dialogues.text: as mercury-like beads of catalyst enter and rise to valves which begin releasing catalyst into the tank. Eddie smiles in satisfaction. A bell rings, and another figure appears beside Bucky - TONY SHANNON, in his fifties, smoothly confident, a private foundation executive equally at home in the lab and in the board room. At the sound of the bell, he puts on dark glasses. Then he notices a pair perched atop Bucky's head. He slides them down over Bucky's face. The others in the lab put their glasses on.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Activate the laser. A techie flips a huge switch and a

dialogues.speaker: LASER DEVICE
dialogues.text: glows brightly, sending beams toward a series of mirrors, which reflect the beams into the tank from different directions.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: peers at the tank through her dark glasses as the water inside begins to roil. She crosses to the computer readout and begins making notes on a chart she carries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leading to a holding tank carry two ping pong balls, which rise toward the tank as hydrogen flows and the

dialogues.speaker: BURN OFF CONTAINER
dialogues.text: ignites, sending a pure blue flame forward.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER TANK
dialogues.text: begins to shudder as the water roils dangerously. Lily, Eddie, and now Shannon are mesmerized as the shuddering increases; Shannon turns quizzically to Bucky, who seems to be waiting, waiting... then Bucky motions to Chen, as if he were cueing the horn section.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Cavitation sound waves... A techie at the console moves a control forward and a hum emanates from the nozzle in the water tank, reducing the shuddering and causing the water to glow an eerie blue... Eddie peers expectantly at his nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: watching the Energy In and Energy Out meters on the console: the Energy Out meter rises slowly. Chen reads from the meters:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: We have a split. Output ratio at point three... output ratio at point four... Lily crosses to a bank of computers, spewing printouts in various graph forms. She studies them as Chen continues:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) Output ratio at point five...

dialogues.speaker: BLAST FURNACE
dialogues.text: ignites: a smallish flame in the huge burner. Shannon turns, stares into the fire but BUCKY seems mesmerized by the bubbling water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point six...

dialogues.speaker: ENERGY METERS
dialogues.text: The Energy Out meter stops its climb.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Holding at point six... It actually drops a little.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) Point five five... Disappointment an Shannon's face. He turns to Bucky, still mesmerized by the activity in the water tank.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) ...and holding at point six...

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Shut it down.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: System shut off. The techies respond; the system shuts off, the flame in the blast furnace falters, leaving the lab in silence. Bucky is deep in thought, absently munching on his peanuts. At last, Shannon speaks up:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Pizza's on me. TITLES END as Bucky shuffles back toward the offices.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE AREA
dialogues.text: A stack of pizza boxes on a main desk, Shannon, Chen, Lily and Eddie sit eating. Eddie is busily sketching on his pad, Bucky is pacing nearby.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: It's music. The others turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) Isn't that odd? We deal in science, but in the end the answers come to us from art. Shannon rolls his unlit cigar in his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What do you mean, Bucky?

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: I want to change the frequency of the acoustic nozzle. Can we build a device which gives us a variable frequency, Eddie? Eddie is sketching, looks up from his pad.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (thinks: ) Sure. Why not? He flips to another page, begins sketching, absently.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: We need to think like children making music. Excite the water with music. The others stare at him, not getting his meaning. Bucky turns to Shannon:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: (continued) Are you worried Mr. Shannon? Shannon grins:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: But your foundation is spending a fortune on us. The least we can do is worry you.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: That's very thoughtful of you. Thank you.  Bucky pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: We're close. We're very close. He turns to the others:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: (continued) We learned something very important today. We found another way that doesn't work. He waves, shuffles off, lost in thought again as Shannon stares after him. Chen stands, stretches.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Lily, take a break. We go back over it tomorrow. Lily looks up from the computer readouts she's studying. She's puzzled:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We're missing some input here...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (not looking up:) I'll have it tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: No, it's not the nozzle, it's... But Chen folds the printout, won't let her read.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Tomorrow, Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon emerges, finally lights his cigar, crosses to his car. He sees Eddie moving toward his motorcycle.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie how are the classes coming?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you keeping up? Doing the reading?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Mostly. Shannon eyes him skeptically. Eddie grins.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Some. Shannon opens Eddie's saddle bag, pulls out a half dozen comics: X-Men, Spawn, Gen 13.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Part of the curriculum?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I've been trading with Chen.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Trading for what? Eddie hands him a book from the same saddle bag: Fundamentals of Physics.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Good. You understand this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Chen does. He doesn't understand that stuff. He means the comics. Shannon smiles, waves, and crosses to his car; Eddie fires up the bike. And as he drives out of the lot, we HEAR, VOICE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We have reached a new stage in the history of man - a stage in which the limits of the past can simply be discarded as old ways of thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots: the halls of learning, students crossing to their classes. Bucky's voice over continues:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We are within sight of an age old dream of mankind. we will soon have the capacity for all peoples in all nations to extinguish poverty. Simply snuff it out, the way we've conquered smallpox, or polio. And what is the source of this new wealth?

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: half full. We are in Bucky's

dialogues.speaker: CLASSROOM
dialogues.text: and Bucky dramatically empties the glass into a tank and places it on a small table top, where in a vastly simplified fashion, he has recreated his experimental device. The tank is bubbling, storing its oxygen and hydrogen in small holding containers.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Water. H20. Two parts hydrogen, one part oxygen. A rather simple matter to separate the two elements... we've done it here. But here's the rub: the energy required to make the split, as we say, is for now greater than the energy we derive from the separated parts. But, see the power of the energy we have created... Bucky crosses to a small tank of hydrogen, turns a valve, lights a match... and BOOM - a small explosion startles the

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: watching in fascination. Nervous laughter. Bucky grins slyly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, after all, the power that destroyed the famous blimp Hindenburg. But what happens when we have learned how to separate those elements in a way that requires very little energy? I will give you the answer. We will transform the world. Think of it: fire from water... We will have an inexhaustible resource. For water is everywhere, and it doesn't matter whether it's clean or dirty, salty or fresh. And here's the truly exciting part. It's a completely non polluting resource as well. For what happens when you burn hydrogen? You get a waste product that is... water. And now Bucky drinks the collected water from the glass he has placed on the table at the beginning of the demonstration, and his

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: laugh and burst into applause as the CAMERA moves up and back and finds Eddie, in the back row, a dozen empty rows between him and the rest of the class. Sketching.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But if we put an end to pollution, perhaps we may also put an end to war.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE'S SKETCH PAD
dialogues.text: A new acoustic nozzle takes form under Eddie's pen...

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: For what is war, but an old idea derived from the notion that we must choose between my security and yours. Why should it be me or you? Why not both of us? All of us? With a plentiful supply of clean energy, we don't have to choose at all. Truly,  we can all live like... billionaires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and as we pull back from the pad, we see we are in Eddie's basement, crammed with gear, tools, gadgets, and especially, sound equipment. Eddie puts a prototype nozzle in place, switches on his amplifier...

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (continued) This glass contains not only water, but a command, a demand, that we develop new ways of thinking, new ways of looking at the world, new ways of being human... ...and a low, rumbling HUMMMM emanates from Eddie's speakers as we CUT TO EXT. EDDIE'S HOUSE - NIGHT . A working class neighborhood; the house practically vibrates on its foundation from the SOUND pouring out of Eddie's basement, drowning out Bucky's lecture and we CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eddie shapes his new nozzle on his lathe, carefully crafting the nozzle's horn, feeling it with his fingers, and there is

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: peering over Eddie's shoulder at the work, until Eddie turns off the lathe. Chen runs his fingers over the nozzle, checking it out.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: You have made your model?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily gonna shoot you. What means necroplasmic goo? Eddie removes his safety goggles, looks at Chen blankly. Chen reads from his Spawn comic:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) "His identity was now forever lost, exchanged for an unholy shell of necroplasmic goo."

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sort of tired blood. (pause) But clotted. Chen doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is slumped inside the water tank, the door open, installing the acoustic nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie... can I interrupt? Eddie looks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) This is Doctor Collier. COLLIER has a wide grin for Eddie. He is in his fifties, outgoing and confident, wearing a dark suit.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Hello, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie's our machinist. He makes the gadgets the rest of the crew get to play with. what have you got here?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: A new acoustic nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're treating the water with sound, hoping to make the hydrogen separation more economical. We also use a catalyst for the same purpose. The two work together. Ah. Dr. Buchaltz, Dr. Collier...

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: A great pleasure: I've been looking forward to meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Dr. Collier is evaluating research programs for the Office of Technology Assessment in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: So much waste in government programs, Dr. Bucholtz. I've been wanting to see how your program runs on private funding.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Well, stick around. You can see if it runs at all.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: (laughs) I'd be delighted!

dialogues.speaker: CONSOLE
dialogues.text: as the board lights up. Chen leans into the microphone:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: We have a green board.

dialogues.speaker: WATER TANK
dialogues.text: The jets spray water into the tank. Collier watches, fascinated. We HEAR CHEN:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Main power. Bubbles appear in the tank, near the electrodes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Injector... Bucky is in his customary deepthink. Shannon rolls his unlit cigar back and forth between his fingers. The bell rings and Shannon has to slip Bucky's dark glasses down from their spot on the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Laser...

dialogues.speaker: LASER
dialogues.text: fires its beams at the mirrors. The water in the tank begins to roil.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: watches... watches... then cues Chen.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Cavitation sound waves... Eddie moves closer to the tank, peers down through the water at the new nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN AND LILY
dialogues.text: At the console:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: We have a split. Output ratio at point three... output ratio at point four... Lily crosses to the computer printouts.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (continued) Output ratio at point five...

dialogues.speaker: BLAST FURNACE
dialogues.text: ignites. Collier turns his face to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Point six...

dialogues.speaker: ENERGY METERS
dialogues.text: The Energy Out meter rises.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Point seven... Still rising. A new note of excitement in Chen's voice:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Point eight... Eddie turns to Bucky, but Bucky is absently shelling peanuts, watching the water tank.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Point nine... and one! Lily drops the printout, turns, trying to make eye contact with someone, anyone...

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: One point two... one point three...

dialogues.speaker: METERS
dialogues.text: The Energy In meter falls rapidly now, the Energy out rising. And suddenly the

dialogues.speaker: BLAST FURNACE
dialogues.text: fires into a giant flame, a huge WHOMP that startles the techies; all eyes on the furnace now:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Two... two point one... Collier and Bucky turn to the fire now, reflected flames dancing in their dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: can't contain his glee. He practically runs to the console, so he can see the meters registering this amazing output.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Two point five... two point six...

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: looks up, as if from a dream, peers around the room.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Shut it down. But in the roar of the furnace, the stunned techies don' hear him. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: (continued) Shut it down! Chen manages to look up from the meters, realizes that Bucky is shouting at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: System shut off! The techies scramble to their tasks; the flame in the furnace sputters out, the hum of machinery quiets. In the silence that follows, no one moves. It is Bucky who finally speaks:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Who brought the marshmallows? The entire lab erupts in a joyous whoop.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Champagne and pizza; the techies are in a party mood, music over the speakers. Lily has a full glass, an instamatic in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Eddie, will you take a shot of us?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sure. She slips her arm around Chen, smiles hugely for the camera. Eddie shoots.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) Let's get everybody. Hey, everybody! Let's get a shot! Oh, Mr. Shannon. She puts her arms around Shannon; she's a little tipsy:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) I just... I... thank you. I am so thrilled!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky stands in the cold night air, shelling peanuts. Collier crosses to his side.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Doctor Bucholtz...

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Bucky.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Bucky. May I shake your hand? I'll never forget this day.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Yes, a big day.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: How long before you'll be ready to announce your findings? Weeks? Months? Bucky chews thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Well. I suppose it belongs to the world, now. I think I'll just send it out on the internet. And as Collier registers his surprise, Eddie emerges from the lab. He calls:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Bucky? They want you for a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The techies have gathered in a group, champagne bottles in hand, silly grins plastered on their faces. Lily is arranging them for the shot as Eddie sets up the camera on a makeshift tripod.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Okay, Mr. Shannon here, Chen, over there - oh, wait, no... She's flushed with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it doesn't matter, just anywhere... Bucky, you have to be in the middle. Do we have everybody? She counts noses. Collier emerges from the shadows:

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Why don't I take the picture? Eddie, you should be in there.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, right, Eddie... of course. Forgive me. As if it never occurred to her. Eddie crosses to Bucky's side. Bucky turns to him, grins:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Thank you. Congratulations to you. And now Lily is at Bucky's side, inserting herself between Bucky and Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Bucky, I'm so proud. Ever since I was a child, I dreamed of something like this. I never imagined it would happen so soon. And she slips her arm around him, plants a big kiss on his cheek as Eddie grins wryly to himself and a

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: from the camera as Collier snaps the picture:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, wait: I was... You have to take another one:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie emerges from the lab, crosses to his bike. Not far away, we HEAR the grinding of an engine. Eddie stops, peers through the darkness, then crosses to a car, raps an the window.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: looks up, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Won't start. Eddie scans the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You're out of gas. She peers at the gauge.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) You shouldn't drive, anyway. Come on, I'll take you home.

dialogues.speaker: LILY AND EDDIE
dialogues.text: cross the parking lot. It's cold, and she huddles in her thin coat.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Kimbark and 54th. She's giddy and a little drunk.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) How come I don't know you better? Are you shy? Or am I just a snob?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You're a snob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're smart, though. Shannon wouldn't hire you if you weren't.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Could've made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Well, even so. You should be proud. It takes everyone working together to do a thing like this. Just being on the team is... it's a great thing, don't you think? Even if you're not... you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you mean. They're standing at a bus stop.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Where are you parked?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Back there. I have a motorcycle. She turns, looks back into the parking lot. The bus arrives, Eddie boards. He holds out his hand for her:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) You'd freeze to death. She looks at the bus as if she's never seen one before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bucky sits at his computer. Chen pokes his head in:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Big excitement today. You think it happen?

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Not so soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell Shannon it happen soon. Bucky grins.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Sometimes it's better to be lucky than good.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: Ah. A NOISE from another part of the lab.

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Someone still here?

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: I think we got rats. They gonna eat our tubing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus moves through the late night streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the nearly deserted bus, Eddie and Lily sit side by side.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: What do you carry in your bag?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Burglar's tools. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Okay, I am a snob. I can't help it. You probably have a great novel in there. He pulls out a fistful of comics. Wrong again.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Why do you read these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm corrupting Chen. Making a real American out of him. Eddie pulls out his book on Physics, begins reading. She looks at him oddly.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Have you read it?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Ages ago. He hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Test me. Ask me anything in there. Lily eyes him with new interest. She opens the book, skims a chapter or two.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (reads: ) Let the potential difference between the inner shell of a Van de Graaff accelerator and the point at which charges are sprayed onto the moving belt be 3.40 MV. If the belt transfers charge to the shell at the rate of 2.80 mO0C/5, what minimum power must be provided to drive the belt? Pause as Eddie considers the question. Then:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Ask me something else. (pause) Well come on, you picked the hardest chapter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chen is on his hands and knees, baiting a rat trap with cheese. He delicately slides the trap under a jutting corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and we watch him as if through the eyes of an observer as

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: takes another trap and baits it, carefully sets it, creeps toward us, slides the trap slowly, slowly... and a sudden BANG... startles Chen and sends

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: to the doorway, peering into the shadowy lab:

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY
dialogues.text: Chen? Chen looks up sheepishly: he's accidentally sprung the trap. When he speaks, it's in his native Chinese:

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: (untranslated) Cocksucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is reading from the physics text, using his hands to illustrate the problem:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: See, you have this tuning fork attached to a stretched wire, and it generates transverse waves. The vibration of the fork is perpendicular to the wire. Its frequency is 400 Hz and the amplitude of its oscillation is 0.50 mm... He turns to Lily, who's out like a light, snoring gently against his shoulder. Eddie puts the book away, peers out the window.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Hey. This is us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie half carries Lily up the stairs to her apartment. She's leaning into him, speaking into his neck.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Big key for this one. Little key inside.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Can you stand up while I do this?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: No problema. He lets her go to fiddle with the key, has to grab her as she sags to her knees...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) Little problema. INT. LILY'S APARTMENT - NIGHT. Eddie helps Lily inside.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Bedroom? She points.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm too serious?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Not right now.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You understand why we need the specs, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yes. He drops her gently onto the bed. Swings her feet up. Slips her shoes off.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Poor Lily. She's too serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Everybody. Never finda husband. He can't help noticing the half dozen or so framed

dialogues.speaker: DIPLOMAS
dialogues.text: not hung but propped modestly on an overflowing book shelf: a BA from South Africa, graduate degrees from schools in London, Paris, science awards from Sydney, the Planck Institute. She's a heavy hitter.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You've been around. But she's already asleep, her arms curled around her pillow for comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chen has baited his last trap, is down on his hands and knees, sliding it carefully under some tubing. He pushes, pushes, can't quite get it where he wants it, has to slide it through a small opening without the damn thing going off... pushes ever so gently... ah. That's it. He's gotten his hands and clothes dirty from trying to position the trap. Still on his knees, he dusts himself off, then rises slowly, looks up... Something he sees startles the hell out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is back on the bus. Peering out the window, thinking about Lily. Smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls up and Eddie alights, heads for his bike parked in the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie hops on, fires it up, pulls slowly past the entrance to the mill lab...

dialogues.speaker: DOOR
dialogues.text: is slightly open, lights shining dimly from the inside. Eddie stops. Considers for a moment. Then he turns the bike off. He crosses to the door, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie enters. Listens for a beat; then says, under his breath:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Anybody home? He crosses to the office area, sees a light shining from the back - Bucky's office. He crosses. And he pokes his head into

dialogues.speaker: BUCKY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: where Bucky's feet are visible, propped on the computer stand behind his desk, his head obscured by the high back of the chair in which he sits.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Bucky? No answer. Bucky's computer is on, the screen casting a dim, green glow into the small office. Eddie repeats:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Bucky? You awake? Still no answer. Eddie crosses to the chair, and what he sees hits him like a hard blow to his chest, taking his breath away:...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is slumped in the chair, his face blue, a plastic bag tied tightly over his head and plastered to his skin with his last inhalation of breath.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Oh, my god: Oh, Jesus... He yanks the bag off Bucky's head with such force that Bucky's inert body falls from the chair onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Oh, Jesus, Bucky! He's down on the floor with Bucky, holding the old man's head back, breathing into his mouth. And then he begins pumping Bucky's chest.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Oh, Bucky, come on... come on... He breathes into his mouth again, pumps his chest, but it's useless.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Oh, shit, oh shit! He scrambles up, searches wildly for a phone, lifts the receiver: the line is dead. The cord dangles loosely to the floor. Eddie darts out of the room into the

dialogues.speaker: HALL
dialogues.text: walking quickly to another office, tries the phone there: the cord is cut. He stands for a moment, trying to make sense of this, then his face darkens. He sniffs... He raises his head, sniffs again...

dialogues.speaker: LAB AREA
dialogues.text: Eddie races in: a soft HISSING SOUND coming from somewhere in the lab. He moves into the lab searching for it's source, stops suddenly:  HYDROGEN STORAGE TANK... is spilling hydrogen into the lab, it's valve wide open. Eddie turns, almost stumbles, past an oxygen storage tank nearby:

dialogues.speaker: OXYGEN STORAGE TANK
dialogues.text: is also hissing, sending a lethal mixture into the lab. Eddie tries to turn the valve shut but it spins uselessly under his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked van, bland, white, pulls to a stop an the bridge. The door on the driver's side opens and a pair of booted feet emerge into the night. In the distance, we can see the hulking mill in the dim light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is frozen with fear. The HISSING SOUND is louder now, but perhaps it is just in Eddie's brain. Slowly, he begins making his way out of the lab...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and once outside, he runs. He grabs the bike, fearful of starting it so near the lab, he pushes it, sweating, until he is willing to gamble. He lets out the clutch and the EXHAUST sputters with a blue flame and EDDIE cringes, expecting an explosion, but there is none. He slips into low gear, speeds on a straight away, tearing through the night as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the booted figure we saw earlier slides the panel door open, reaches for a small detonator resting on the rear seat. He holds the detonator in both hands as

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: puts his head down and roars away and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is plunged down. From our view on the bridge...

dialogues.speaker: THE MILL
dialogues.text: erupts in a violent explosion that suggests a mighty bomb, sending huge pieces of debris into the air anda

dialogues.speaker: ROLLING SHOCK WAVE
dialogues.text: that threatens to overtake Eddie on his bike, and finally does, sending him careening into the brush beside the road as

dialogues.speaker: PIECES OF THE MILL
dialogues.text: begin to descend like shrapnel on the neighborhood, raining destruction from the winter night sky...

dialogues.speaker: A BOILER
dialogues.text: crashing through the roof of an American Legion Hall...

dialogues.speaker: LILY'S CAR
dialogues.text: rolling like tumbleweed across the parking lot...

dialogues.speaker: ROW OF HOUSES
dialogues.text: ignited by flaming shards landing on the peaked roofs, and WE CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: A TELEPHONE
dialogues.text: ringing in the night once, twice, a hand reaches for it, we are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Shannon picks up the phone and says, groggily:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yes... We can HEAR a torrent of words spoken so loudly, so rapidly, coming through the phone, it almost lifts Shannon to a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) ... Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utter devastation: the mill has been leveled, a shroud of thick smoke diffusing the weak winter light and giving an other worldly sense to the scene. Fire department investigators comb the wreckage, as police maintain the barricades set up to keep the crowds of curious away. A television newsreporter (RITA BLISS) is doing a standup, with the smoking ruins in the background:

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: The incredible devastation from last night's blast is only now becoming apparent, and has left workers at this scene with a sense of utter disbelief. Just what was going on here and what might have caused the - powerful explosion is still not clear, although according to sources at the university, the mill had been converted into a site for the experimental production of hydrogen fuel. It was not, these sources say, supposed to be dangerous. But tell that to this once peaceful neighborhood whose quiet was shattered last night. And tell that to the dozens of local, state and federal Investigators who have descended on this spot, trying to make sense from the bits and pieces of what is left...

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RAYMOND FORD
dialogues.text: a tall, soft spoken man with a hint of New York Irish in his speech moves through the gloom, led by an aide, to a spot where Eddie and Shannon stand.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: This is agent Raymond Ford from the FBI, Mr. Shannon, who runs the Franklin Foundation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: ...and Mr. Kopek.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Hello. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (continued) You were the one who was here last night?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We were all here. But yeah, I came back later.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: And when you got here, Dr. Bucholtz was dead?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: How do you know he was dead, son?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: He had a plastic bag over his head. He was blue...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Could he have done it himself? Eddie looks offended by the question:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. He wouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (to his Aide: ) Okay, I want everyone who worked at the lab in my office. Mr. Shannon, if you don't mind, I'd like to have you, too. I want a search of Dr. Bucholtz' office at the University. I want a search of Mr. Shannon's  foundation... Mr. Shannon, I hope you'll make this easy for us... As he begins to move off, the newsreporter presses him:

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Mr. Ford, may I ask a few questions...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: No, Ma'am. He moves quickly, but she keeps up:

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Do you have any leads?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: No, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: RITA
dialogues.text: Can you tell us why the FBI is involved?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Ma'am, we just had eight city blocks disappear. That's why we're involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen TV news trucks are parked nearby as a group of newsmen mill about, waiting for word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A madhouse: agents moving back and forth as, inside various offices and cubicles we see the techies and scientists from the lab being interviewed. We FOLLOW a secretary into

dialogues.speaker: FORD'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: where Ford and other agents are interviewing Shannon:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: They were scientists. Highly trained, experts in their field.  Some technical assistants, graduate students, mostly...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Suppose you start from the beginning. How many altogether?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I'd have to think...

dialogues.speaker: SECOND OFFICE
dialogues.text: A large room where Eddie, Lily and a half dozen techies from the lab are undergoing interrogation by a group of agents.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I'd come back for my bike.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAY
dialogues.text: You'd taken Miss Naughton home?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: She couldn't get her car started. She'd had a little bit to drink.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAY
dialogues.text: You have a relationship with Miss Naughton?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. She's a physicist. A blank look from the agent.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) I'm a machinist. He casts an eye across the room at Lily, answering another agent's question. She seems stunned, red eyed from lack of sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was hired by Dr. Chen.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MASTERS
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: He was Dr. Bucholtz's project manager.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MASTERS
dialogues.text: Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: He's home, I'd imagine.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MASTERS
dialogues.text: You have a number for him?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT MASTERS
dialogues.text: Let's get him in here. why did he hire you?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Because I'm smart. And I speak Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I found Dr. Chen in China. He'd run into trouble with the Chinese authorities. I helped arrange for him to come here.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: What sort of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: He was involved in the pro democracy movement. Not a good thing to be, in China.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: And what about this Kopek guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Is he one of your scientists?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: No. But he's good at what he does.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: What do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I've known him for a long time. Dad was a plumber, and thena union official. He had a union scholarship to college, but he had to leave school...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (shrugs: ) I think he was having problems. Spent a couple years in the army. I ran into him again working in a machine shop. He was good and I hired him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of agents are with Shannon's worried secretary:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: These are the entire foundation offices?.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: In Chicago, yes. We have other offices in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: And the personnel at the lab were technically employees of the foundation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: Can you show us the personnel files?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: They're over here. That drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and two FBI agents enter, followed by the building superintendent, who has a key to the door. The agents split up, and we follow one into the

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: where yesterday's dishes remain in the sink, unwashed. The super appears in the kitchen doorway:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAY
dialogues.text: When's the last time you saw him?

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT GRAY
dialogues.text: What time?

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: He go to work same time, everyday. Little Chinese guy. Always said hello.

dialogues.speaker: FORDS OFFICE
dialogues.text: Ford's phone rings. Ford picks up:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Ford... yeah. Okay. Find him. He hangs up, turns to Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (continued) Your Doctor Chen is missing. Shannon can't fathom this; he holds Ford's stare with hi own, his face clouding in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie emerges, is immediately engulfed in a shouting mob of reporters:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Can you tell us what's going on up there?... Excuse me, sir... Do they have any suspects?... Was it a bomb?... Who are they talking to?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I don't know anything. I'm sorry. He makes his way through the mob, but they've already spotted someone else coming out of the door: it's

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: nearly overwhelmed as the horde descends an her:

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Miss, would you speak to us?... Pardon me, who are you?... What's happening up there?...Was this a terrorist attack?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I don't know... Please, let me through...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTERS
dialogues.text: Do you work at the lab?... What's your name?... Is Dr. Bucholtz dead?... How many were killed?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know anything, please... She makes it to the curb, looks up for a cab, finds Eddie standing on the steps of a bus:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Need a ride? The mob of microphones and cameras stalks her. It only takes her a split second to consider. She hops on the bus as it pulls away, leaving a sea of cameras and microphones in its wake.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: A press conference, with Ford at the microphone, backed up by Chicago police and a room jammed with reporters.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We have not ruled out an accident, but our investigation is proceeding on the assumption that the laboratory was sabotaged...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: By whom?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We can't say at this point.

dialogues.speaker: RITA BLISS
dialogues.text: Mr. Ford, we have reports that Dr. Bucholtz was killed in the explosion...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We have a similar report. I don't want to say too much about that...

dialogues.speaker: RITA BLISS
dialogues.text: Can you tell us if he's presumed dead? The SOUND is abruptly MUTED. We are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Shannon puts the remote control down, picks up his phone, dials. We HEAR the voice answering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Collier's office...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: It's Tony Shannon for Dr. Collier.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Dr. Collier is en route from Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Have him call me when he gets in. He hangs up, sinks deeper into his couch. the remote, points it at the set:

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER TELEVISION SET
dialogues.text: as the press conference continues:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: We're looking for one of the employees at the lab, Dr. Lu Chen... Chen's picture appears on screen; we're in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Lily and Eddie slump with exhaustion in set, steaming coffee cups in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (continued) We'd appreciate help from anyone who might know of his whereabouts...

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Is he a suspect?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: No. Not at this time. we're simply concerned with his well being... Lily snaps the TV off. He picks up front of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think he did it. She rises, crosses to the kitchen, enters. Eddie follows:

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Lily is making herself busy with the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why would he do it?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: He wouldn't. But he looks different and he talks different and they're going to think he did it.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Where do you think he is?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is. (pause: something occurs to her:) You don't think he did it...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. I'm not saying that...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Well what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I'm just wondering where he is...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: ...because I don't know you very well. I've only been here for six months. I don't know anyone very well. My family isa million miles away... and I'm scared. Tears start down her cheeks. She tries to wipe them away, angrily throws the sponge into the sink, pushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) I think you better go. And she disappears into her bedroom, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bundle of papers is ripped open by a news dealer. Screaming headlines:

dialogues.speaker: BLAST MYSTERY DEEPENS
dialogues.text: Noted Professor Was Dead Before Explosion And just below the fold, a picture of Chen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS once, twice... automatically answers, begins spitting out a fax message.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: emerges from her bedroom, groggy with sleep, peers down at the incoming

dialogues.speaker: FAX
dialogues.text: ...it's in Chinese. Some movement across the room catches her eye, startles her: It's Eddie, staring at her bleary eyed, from the couch where he's been sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I thought you shouldn't be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An agent scurries down the hall, carrying a folder in his hands, enters Ford's office.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: I think you better look at this. Ford is on the phone, looks like he's just swallowed bad food. He holds his hand up:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: That's all you have?... How reliable is it?... Thanks. You better get me some paper on it. He hangs up, looks at the folder the agent has opened an his desk.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: It's Kopek's file.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: Had to leave college for disciplinary reasons. Ford looks up into the agent's eyes:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: (continued) Broke into a science lab after hours. Apparently doing some sort of experiment. He blew the hell out of the lab. I mean, maybe this is a coincidence, but Lord A'mighty...

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: I want his house searched. Get hold of anybody who knows him, family, friends. Let's find out about this guy. Same with Lily Naughton. Pick ‘em both up.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: Lily Naughton?  A nod to the phone:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Central Intelligence has been tracking this Chen guy for months. They think he's in China.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: China:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Reported on a plane out of Vancouver yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily and Eddie on a bench beside the river; Lily is studying the fax; she seems stunned, in shock:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: This is a lie...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It has Chen's name on it, but it's not from Chen.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It uses a vernacular he couldn't speak.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It says I should join him. It says the information is in safe hands.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Join him where?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: In China.  She folds the fax, puts it in her pocket. She can barely say the words:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) I'm being framed. Silence as Eddie tries to make sense of this. She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) Look, you don't know me. There's no reason for you to believe me...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I do believe you.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: ...I don't know anything about this. This isn't Chen... I don't know who sent this... She rises, starts walking away, quickly.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Lily:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Don't follow me: Please don't follow me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily, I believe you: She wheels, continues on, practically running. Eddie has to sprint after her.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Lily! wait... He catches her, turns her to him, she's quaking with fear:  INT.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Lily, you have to trust somebody. It might as well be me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANKLIN FOUNDATION OFFICES
dialogues.text: Ford and another agent have Shannon under fire:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You knew this kid had been thrown out of school?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: He resigned.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Under pressure, wouldn't you say?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: There was some pressure, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Kid practically blows down a science building...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: It was an interesting experiment. It might have worked.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: How did you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I was on the science faculty at the time.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell us about it yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I didn't think it was relevant.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: You don't see some small connection here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Mr. Shannon, I got something here that doesn't smell right. I got a big bang in the middle of the night. I got a professor dead. CIA tells me Chen might be involved in espionage. This Kopek guy has a past that makes me nervous. All the threads run right back to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cons poke through the workshop, opening drawers, peering into containers. Agent Schmidt is overseeing the work:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: Any explosives, any fire accelerants, anything at all... be creative... A VOICE comes from upstairs:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jim... you better get up here. Schmidt climbs the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Schmidt enters with Agent Gray; a couple of cops are in the bedroom, pulling apart the bedding, the drawers in Eddie's bureau.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: What've you got? Gray leads him to a small black bag, which they've taken from Eddie's closet. He hoists the bag onto the bed, opens it:

dialogues.speaker: BAG
dialogues.text: stuffed with money.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: Where'd you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back of the closet. Under a pile of old clothes.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: How much? Gray stands scratching his beard, estimating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secretary opens the door, pokes her head in:

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Mr. Ford? A call for you. Ford picks up the phone:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Ford... (pause) Okay. I want him. Get every fucking cop in the city. He hangs up, turns to Shannon:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: (continued) You know anybody who'd put fifty thousand dollars in a black bag and give it to your Mr. Kopek?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon drives through rush hour traffic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and pulls into the underground parking facility as

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE STREET
dialogues.text: an unmarked city car pulls into a parking space and stops. The driver watches as Shannon's car disappears into the garage...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Shannon parks his car in his usual spot, emerges, crosses toward the elevator. It's dark and a little spooky in the garage. Shannon hears FOOTSTEPS coming from somewhere - the echoes confuse him. He stops, turns: no one behind him. He continues, is startled by two figures stepping from behind a pillar; it's

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Tony we need some help. Someone's trying to frame Lily.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: She got a fax, supposedly from Chen. It's not from Chen. It makes her look like she's involved in this...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What do you know about the bag, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What bag?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: The cops found one in your closet. Stuffed with cash. Now it's Eddie's turn to be shocked:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Think, Eddie! Could someone have left it there? Was it someone else's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No one's been in my place... I don't know anything about a bag:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus: what's happening: Shannon lets out a breath:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Alright, listen. I believe you. I believe you both. I don't know what's happening, but I'm going to find out. I know some people who might know the answer. But for now, you're both in danger. They've got half the police in Chicago looking for you. Do you have someplace to go?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I have friends...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: No good. They'll know your friends. How about you, Lily?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Friends here are no good. How about someplace else? She thinks:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Can you get there? How much money do you have? He's already reaching for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Give me some time. Then call me, I'm going to do what I can.  There's a car parked outside, a cop. He's following me. Wait five minutes before you go. He turns to go, then stops:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued ) Be careful. We're gonna get to the bottom of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as cops' rifle through Lily's things. In the silence, her phone RINGS, once, twice. The cops stop, listen: Lily's answering machine picks up, but instead of a voice on the other end, the machine begins printing a fax. One, of the cops walks over, stares at the incoming message: CoP What the hell is this? It's Chinese...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon emerges; hurries away, pulling his coat up around his face as if trying to hide. cop in the unmarked car opposite, watching. He gets out, follows Shannon at a discreet distance. EDDIE AND LILY. watch as the cop follows Shannon. Then they move quickly on foot out of the garage and down the block in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon enters, picks up a paper, scans the headlines:

dialogues.speaker: SEEK TWO IN SOUTHSIDE BLAST
dialogues.text: Pictures of Eddie and Lily on the front page. Shannon steps into a phone booth, dials. Waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Collier, please... It's Tony Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One moment.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collier sits in the semi darkness behind a huge desk.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You tell me. You've got termites in your house. I think you better get back here.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you leaving it up to me?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily is on the payphone.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Eight fifteen... thank you. She hangs up. She crosses to Eddie at the bar, sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) There's an 8:15 to Madison. He speaks without looking at her:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Meet you there. Get out of here. He rises, heads to the men's room. She watches him, uncomprehending, until she sees a guy down the bar with the newspaper, casually studying the two of them, lookin at the pictures on the front page. He turns, watches as Eddie passes to the men's room. When he turns back to Lily, she's already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily hails a cab, enters.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Union Station.

dialogues.speaker: CABBIE
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma'am. He pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie emerges from the men's room, moves past the man with the paper, exits. The man stuffs his paper under his arm, follows Eddie to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with the paper watches as Eddie melts into the crowd on the street. He seems unsure, is about to re- enter the bar, when a police car passes slowly.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH PAPER
dialogues.text: Hey: He flags the car down, crosses, sticks his head in the window and says something to the cop driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie moves through the crowd. It's rush hour and the sidewalks are jammed with people buttoned up against the icy blast. A sudden NOISE startles him and we CUT To a

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: southbound on the Avenue making a screaming U-turn acros six lanes of traffic, and sliding to a halt at the curb. Two cops lump out and scan the scene. Eddie tries to disappear into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: have spotted him. Eddie breaks into a run, but the sidewalk is too crowded. He darts into the street, running south into oncoming traffic, dodging taxis like a broken field runner. The cops are in pursuit, chasing him down the middle of the street. In the distance are the sounds of APPROACHING SIRENS. Then he hears another noise - the deep bellow of a SHIP'S HORN, and the CLANG CLANG of the traffic barricades coming down on the bridge ahead. He turns: there are squad cars inbound on both side streets. He's cut off. No choice but to make for the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: is already in motion as Eddie slides under the crossing arm and leaps onto the deck. One of the pursuing cops is right behind him. Eddie scrambles up the tilting incline, slipping and sliding on the icy surface. The cop isn't doing any better. Desperately, Eddie works his way over to the side rail. He uses it like a ladder to claw his way up. The cop is in reach. He grabs for Eddie - manages a grip an Eddie's shoe! cop For just the briefest moment, the cop and Eddie hang together - their eyes meet - and in the cop's agonized expression we can see that he's slipping... slipping... until his grip releases and he crashes onto the sidewalk below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BRIDGE TENDER moves to the window. He can't believe his eyes. There's a man climbing up the side rail.  The Tender lunges for the brake lever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie makes it to the lip of the rising bascule - now eight stories above the pavement - just as it shudders to a halt. It nearly shakes him loose. Clinging by his fingers, he grips the steel edge of the spar... He looks down and sees a half dozen cops, guns drawn, shouting at him from the pavement below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cops come pounding up the steps, enter the tower.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: How do we get him down?

dialogues.speaker: TENDER
dialogues.text: I dunno. We move it and well shake him loose...

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Alright, don't move it. (into his radio: ) Where the hell's the goddam boat?

dialogues.speaker: TENDER
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND COP
dialogues.text: The guy who blew up the lab.

dialogues.speaker: TENDER
dialogues.text: Jesus! He peers out at Eddie. And WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: clinging to the top of the span, barely able to hold an in the icy wind. As he looks up, he finds himself staring into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the skyscrapers bordering Michigan Avenue, now filling with spectators who suddenly find themselves with front row seats for the unexpected drama, their faces awash in the red and blue lights from the police and emergency vehicles below. Eddie manages a toe-hold on the side rail. With a final effort, he inches up on top of the bridge. He looks down:

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: have gathered on Michigan Avenue. On the other side of the raised roadway is the open mouth of the lower level - and the icy river, 100 feet below. And in the window, nearly at his own level, a SECRETARY holds a message she has scrawled: Call me: (312) 555-9795 Marie A sudden blinding light from below, and WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: where a TV crew has set up for business. Behind them, a crowd gathers, faces turned upward like a field of sunflowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A police boat slows to maneuvering speed as it approaches the open span. On the afterdeck, one OFFICER talks into his radio as two other men adjust their fins and wet suits.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Marine three-five. We got two divers on deck.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Copy, three-five. He looks up at Eddie, brilliantly lit against the black:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) Alright, bring him down. Slowly. The tender moves to his machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge shudders. Eddie is thrown off balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS cops and the TV crew look on, Eddie teeters, then disappears. A horrified GASP from the crowd as

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: falling, grabs a pipe running from the upper to the lower level and slides down it like a fireman.

dialogues.speaker: COPS
dialogues.text: on Michigan Avenue scatter to the side rails to see if he hit the water.

dialogues.speaker: BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Eddie lands on the lower level footbridge. He loses his footing and begins to slide down the steep incline - straight for the grinding gears of the bridge mechanism. Desperately clawing at the side rail, he tries to catch himself before he's caught in the churning gears. But he can't hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immense gears interlock, meshing together like the workings of a giant clock. It looks like time has run out as Eddie falls into the machinery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tender grabs the brake lever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the bridge shudders to a halt. Several cops rush into the concrete chamber that houses the bridge mechanism. Shining their lights into the gears, they search for Eddie - but there's no sign of him. The cops are mystified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily enters, crosses toward the ticket booths:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: The eight fifteen to Madison.

dialogues.speaker: TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: One. Lily turns, sees a pair of cops strolling through the station, scanning the crowds. She peers up at the clock:

dialogues.speaker: CLOCK
dialogues.text: It's a few minutes past eight. She turns back to the ticket agent.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) You better make that two..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shadows of the bridge structure work in Eddie's favor as he inches along a beam set into the face of the gigantic concrete counterweight. Below him - one false step away - is the empty blackness of the dry well. On the other side, cops are shouting at each other. As their flashlights play across him, he sucks himself into the channel of an I-Beam, and tries not to look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford comes pounding up the steps, joining the Tender and the two cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing his badge) FBI, Sergeant. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Damned if I know.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Let's get the bridge down and find him.

dialogues.speaker: TENDER
dialogues.text: If he's down there in the machinery, we'll squash him like a bug.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: What do you suggest?

dialogues.speaker: TENDER
dialogues.text: I only work here.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Take it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wedged between two steel beams, Eddie is sweating bullets as the cops sweep the area around him. Suddenly, the ALARM BELLS sound and the WHIRR and GRIND of machinery starts again. The bridge is moving. Wide eyed, Eddie realizes that the two beams he's sandwiched between are closing in on him. A COP is right beside him, nearly close enough to touch. Eddie is trapped. At last, the cop moves on and Eddie eases clear at the last second. He looks up. There is a narrow gap between the roadway and the bridge but it's closing fast. He makes a leap - catches the edge of the bridge - and slithers through the opening as it closes like a ponderous guillotine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging like a gopher onto the lower level roadway, Eddie slides under the first car in line. He catches his breath and looks around. There are cops all over the place, but none right on top of him. Moving on knees and elbows, he slithers on down the line under the next car and the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily steals another nervous glance at the clock: eight ten. Two cops are approaching. She turns to an OLD WOMAN nearby, slips her arm through the woman's arm:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you mind walking me to my train? I get so nervous when I have to travel.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: Aw, nothin' to it. Come on. Where we goin'?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. I'm sucha goose. She buries her face in the woman's shoulder and moves past the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridge is being sealed off and the cops are frantically clearing the area. A city salt truck idling in line is finally able to back up: CoP Okay, move it, move it: The driver slams it in gear and as it trundles past, we see the tarp on top of the load has an extra hump. And it's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock hand leaps to eight fifteen. We HEAR the announcer:

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Final call for the eight fifteen to Madison.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: comes running into the station, moving through the crowd, nearly knocking down a red cap with a load of luggage as

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: begins to move, silently...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Where's the train to Madison?

dialogues.speaker: REDCAP
dialogues.text: Track nine, but you too late. Go ahead, run. Eddie runs. Ahead, chatting casually, watching the train, are the two cops. No way for Eddie to make it past them. The train is gathering speed. Eddie slows, begins walking, casually, trying to hide his face. It's agonizing. The train is simply outgaining him, pulling away. The cops scan the platform area... Eddie stops. Nothing to do now but watch the train depart. It is moving further away, out of reach. And suddenly, the train stops, brakes hissing, the cars jouncing together noisily. The cops are on the alert. They hurry to the train just as the

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: alights onto the platform, turns, and helps the old woman off the train. CoP What's the trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had the wrong train. St. Louis is track seven, Ma'am. And the cops watch as the old woman makes her way across the platform. The spot where Eddie was standing is now vacant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily sits alone, staring at the two tickets in her hand as the conductor makes his way down the aisle toward her. There is a voice behind her. It's Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: This seat taken? He sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train plows through the night landscape. And WE CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi swings around in a wide arc, illuminating the Madison sign in it's beams, then pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi approaches an oddly shaped building, pulls up in front and stops, its lights illuminating a sign saying "Observatory". Eddie and Lily emerge, cross to the building and enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hall lights are on, but most of the offices are dark. Eddie and Lily move down the hallway, come upon the night WATCHMAN, dozing at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Excuse me... I'm looking for Maggie Horner.  He blinks awake.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: Might try the door down at the end of the hall, around the corner. He points. Watches as Eddie and Lily follow his directions. Then he settles back in his chair and closes his eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily enter. A huge telescope dominates the room, at the base of which, a single seat is occupied by a woman (MAGGIE) in her late twenties, wearing bib overalls, her eye glued to the telescope sight.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Hold on. She makes notes on a board she holds on her lap.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Maggie... Maggie finally turns, annoyed, is startled to see Lily:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ! The board slips to the floor. She leaps from the seat, throws her arms around Lily.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (continued) How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We took the train. Maggie, this is Eddie. Maggie looks from one to the other.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It's bullshit, isn't it. The whole thing. You guys have  nothing to do with what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I knew it. You're being framed.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, Maggie, thank god for you.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Everybody gets framed. Oswald, the Rosenbergs, Alger Hiss, it's nothing to be ashamed of.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We're not ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You watch, they're gonna catch the unabomber. Some poor sonofabitch. I've been calling you all night... Eddie interrupts:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Calling where?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Calling Lily...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Did you leave your name? On the machine?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Well, yeah... my name, my number... why? She can tell from the look on their faces she's done something wrong, but she doesn't know what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jetliner lands. WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS passengers emerge through the gangway, Shannon among them. A neatly dressed young man calls his name:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Shannon? I'm your driver. They move off together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warehouse, but it might be a museum - stacked with obsolete gear from various physics and astronomy labs. The door opens and Maggie enters, with Lily and Eddie trailing.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I think you'll be alright in here. There's a sofa against the wall. The grad students use it for naps. Maggie watches Eddie as he wanders into the room, peering at the odd collection. Maggie turns to Lily, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Are you sleeping with him?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Maggie.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: He's cute.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I hadn't noticed.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You hadn't noticed?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Maggie, somebody is trying to wreck my life! Excuse me if I  haven't had time to work it into my dating habits.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: You don't have any dating habits. A look from Lily.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (continued) There's only one sofa.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We'll work something out.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black government sedan pulls into the driveway and toward the white frame house set back from the road. As the car nears the house, a sensor registers its presence, bathing the house and surrounding area in high intensity light, revealing three other cars parked nearby. Shannon emerges from the car, enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon enters. Collier is there to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Hello, Tony. Good flight?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Good enough. .

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You know Art Bentley from Intelligence. This is Paul Ryan from D.O.D and Arthur Coburn from State. Three men nod hellos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
