dialogues.text: (continued) You know the drill. We have to log you in. He offers Shannon a standard form, which Shannon reads quickly and signs under the gaze of the others. He looks up when he's done:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Better have a seat. Shannon sits on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: (continued) The short of it is you had a leak. We think the Chinese government had Chen's family back in Shanghai. They put the squeeze on him and he broke. Shannon absorbs this without a flicker:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Early on, from all we can tell.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We think Miss Naughton. Maybe Eddie Kopek.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You were close to him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I hired him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're checking on him, Tony. It could be they set him up. Planted the money.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BENTLEY
dialogues.text: We're guessing. Maybe to hide Naughton and Chen.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We need him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You've got half the known universe looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Tony, we have reason to believe they can't get the damned thing working. We think they're missing a piece of the puzzle. It's possible Kopek has it. Maybe it's Naughton. Maybe both. If it's true, then they like looking for him, too.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: If the FBI gets him, it'll be on Ted Koppel by nightfall. we're in a very sensitive situation with the Chinese government. The bureau wants to make it public.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Fuck the Chinese. They're stealing secrets.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: When the time comes, we'll fuck the Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Why don't you just call the bureau off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd look bad, they'd never go quietly. We'd have a lot of explaining to do. what kind of guy is this Kopek?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Don't underestimate him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Smart enough to keep the bureau out of his hair?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I don't know. If he's that smart, he's also smart enough to keep you out of his hair.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We have an advantage.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily lies on the couch, Eddie on a makeshift arrangement on the floor nearby.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily? You awake?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Do you have the fax from Chen?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Let me see it.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You want to brush up on your Chinese?  And WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watchman is making his rounds, checking doors.

dialogues.speaker: EQUIPMENT ROOM
dialogues.text: Eddie is studying the fax, Lily kneeling beside him.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: There's a fax number here.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: What about it?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: So let's find out where it came from.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You mean send a fax?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. whoever sent the fax from Chen would know exactly where we are. Some other way. Lily thinks.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I send E mail to China all the time. I could ask somebody to check the number. She peers at Eddie. New found warmth in her voice:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) You do believe me. He puts his hand to her mouth, hushing her; they listen as the watchman's FOOTSTEPS ring just beyond the door. The door handle turns, but it's locked. The watchman's

dialogues.speaker: FOOTSTEPS
dialogues.text: fade down the hall, and Lily breathes at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, frame house, snowbound but for the neatly shoveled walk, on the grounds of the observatory. Maggie emerges, her arms loaded down with old clothes, a coffee cup in her hand, a newspaper stuffed under her arm. She crosses toward the observatory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie enters. The watchman from the night before is still there.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Hi, George. You still here?

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: Frank went ice fishing. Doing a double shift. You had some visitors last night. He eyes the clothes, the coffee cup. Maggie takes a gulp of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I did. An old... friend. From graduate school.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: That today's paper?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'll let you have it when I'm finished. See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie enters, waking Eddie and Lily. She dumps the clothes on a counter.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I brought you a change of clothes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What for? She tosses him the morning paper; Eddie scans the headlines:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: They've got a pretty good description of what you guys are wearing.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Maggie, we need to send some E mail. Maggie takes a second to think:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Student Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie's beat-up Plymouth is stuck in the snow and ice. She is behind the wheel, Eddie and Lily pushing, but it's no use. The watchman approaches, calling:

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: Need a hand?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (under her breath: ) Shit. (cheerily: ) Would you? George, these are my friends Mary and... and John. He crosses to the rear of the car.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: Which one is Mary? Just kidding. Let's give 'er the ol' heave ho. The three of them put their shoulders to the car, and it slowly frees itself from the mush.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: (continued) There you are. Where you headed, Miss Horner?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: The Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how about that paper?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh, the paper. I'll get youa new one. She waves and pulls away. The watchman returns to the observatory, just as a campus police car pulls up at the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAMPUS COP
dialogues.text: Hiya, George. Looking for Margaret Horner.

dialogues.speaker: WATCHMAN
dialogues.text: Just missed her. There's a federal agent in the seat beside him. He hands two photos to the watchman:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Have you seen these people?

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOS
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awash in students, coming and going. In the parking area outside, a half dozen charter buses sit idling in the frigid air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of personal computers: Maggie and Lily sit at one of, them, waiting for a response. Eddie is a short way off, peering out of the window at the buses.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (whispers: ) How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Now did what go?  She looks

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Last night.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I think we should split up.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (appalled: ) Why?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Because they're looking for two people.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. up, sees Eddie in his changed clothes:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (continued) God, he looks great in tweed, doesn't he? begins printing out the response to Lily's E mail; it's in Chinese. Lily stares at the message, dumbfounded, as Eddie crosses to them. She looks

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What does it say?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It says the fax number is assigned to a personal residence in Beijing.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What residence? up, peers into his face before she answers:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: The United States Military Attaché.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of pay phones in a busy hallway. Maggie is at one of the phones, Eddie and Lily hovering nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Anthony Shannon, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon's secretary on the phone, as we intercut:

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: I'm afraid he's not here. Who may I say is calling?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It's personal... The secretary looks up at FBI agent Schmidt, sitting beside some fancy electronic gear, listening in. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: He's in Washington. Would you like me to transfer the call?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Yes. Schmidt peers down at his gear, casually: the number on Maggie's phone appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half dozen police cars pull up outside the union, disgorge officers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Maggie awaits the transfer; she whispers to Eddie:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: He's in Washington...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Washington!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Shannon's office.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Anthony Shannon, please.

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON SECRETARY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who's calling?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It's personal.

dialogues.speaker: WASHINGTON SECRETARY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Can you hold, please? Maggie holds as

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: enter the union, begin fanning out. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Agent Schmidt listens into the transferred call and WE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Shannon picks up a telephone: it is attached to an electronic device, and when Shannon speaks...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Tony Shannon... ...the phones on

dialogues.speaker: AGENT SCHMIDT
dialogues.text: squawk and emit a pure digital static that makes Schmidt wince and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Maggie leaves the booth and hands the phone to Eddie, who enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I'm in Madison. Listen, this is crazy: The fax from Chen came from the US embassy in Beijing... He looks out of the phone booth at a hallway full of cops:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Are you secure?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie, listen to me carefully. We're gonna pick you up. Stay where you are... The last of the cops pass, heading down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I can't stay where I am. I'll come to you. He hangs up as

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: is left hanging:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie has Lily by the hand, leading her quickly down the hall in the opposite direction of the cops, Maggie hustling beside them. Through the doors to the outside, we can SEE TwO COPS  and the FBI agent we saw at the observatory taking up positions where they can keep an eye on the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Lily, wait. Let me help. Try those buses. She hugs Eddie; then she hugs Lily:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Good luck. Don't be such a jerk. And she's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggie emerges, crosses to the cops:

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me... you know those people in the paper this morning?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: I'm Maggie Horner. I think they just snuck out the back way.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: watch this from their vantage point just inside the entrance. Maggie points down the walk leading away from the union, then follows as the cops and the agent head off in that direction. And then, Eddie and Lily burst through the doors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and cross rapidly toward the buses. A young man dressed incongruously in a raccoon coat and a straw boater stands before a bus door with a clipboard in his hands. He grins as he sees Eddie and Lily approaching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Findlay?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (thinking quickly) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: (checking off a name) You're the last. Get right on. Eddie and Lily climb the bus stairs. And now we see the placard in the window: YOUNG REPUBLICAN CLUB OF WISCONSIN.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: (continued) Excuse me... are there two of you?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. This is Mrs. Findlay.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Oh. I didn't realize you were both coming.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Last minute thing.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: No problem. Delighted to have you both... And as they turn into the bus, the man stops them again:

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: (continued) Um... excuse me. You've only paid for one ticket.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. How much is it? He fumbles for his wallet:

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Well you've already paid for the room. That'll be another ninety dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: At the lodge, yes. Did you want separate rooms?.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Of course not. She slips her arm through Eddie's.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: That includes meals, of course. Eddie peers into his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Will you take sixty on account? I'll have to get to a cash machine.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Oh... what the heck. We're all Republicans. They board the bus, and the man in the raccoon coat waves as the driver pulls away. And as he heads for the union, a man comes running through the parking lot, lugging a pair of boots and skis. It is, of course, poor FINDLAY, desperately out of breath:

dialogues.speaker: FINDLAY
dialogues.text: Where's the bus?

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Just left.

dialogues.speaker: FINDLAY
dialogues.text: Goddamit: I paid for my ticket.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: FINDLAY
dialogues.text: Jack Findlay.  Raccoon coat turns and peers after the bus, now too far away to hail. Then he turns back to Findlay, as if something has just occurred to him:

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Mr. Findlay... do you know where your wife is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A government sedan pulls up in front of a handsome town house. Agent Ford emerges from the car, along with a driver. They cross to the entrance. WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: As it drops on an elegantly polished desk.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: The Franklin Foundation's file at the IRS. Shall I tell you what's in it? We are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon is at his desk, the file in front of him. Ford stands before him as the other agent sits.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Your funding comes from a number of different sources. But when the checks are cashed, they end up at the same bank. In classified accounts. Why do you suppose that is?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I couldn't say. Shannon lights his cigar. Ford drops a second file on top of the first.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Your resume. Very impressive. Leaves out one important thing.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is who pays your salary.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: And who would that be?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Well, now, that's where it gets interesting. I have a friend at Langley who tells me they pay your salary.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: That is interesting. Have to check into that myself. A deep drag on the cigar, a cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: A man might be forgiven for concluding that your foundation is a front for the people at Langley as well. Mr. Shannon, do I need to tell you that interfering with a federal investigation is a crime?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I know the law, Mr. Ford.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Then perhaps you'd like to share a little information with us.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Such as?

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Such as what's going on here.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I have no idea. I'd tell you if I did. Ford leans over, until he is practically nose to nose with Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Alright. I'm going to do you the favor of being frank with you. These people are suspects in  crimes of murder and espionage. I'm gonna find them. If it turns out you and your friends at Langley are trying to get in my way, I'll fry your ass so bad you'll never sit down again. He gathers up the folders and leaves Shannon puffing on his cigar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Findlay and the Raccoon Coat are studying photos of Lily and Eddie. Two cops and the agent await their judgment.

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: That's them.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: They got on the bus?

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Just before it pulled out.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Where's it going?

dialogues.speaker: RACOON COAT
dialogues.text: Lake Geneva. They oughta be there pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls into the parking area and stops. The Republicans alight and head for the registration desk Eddie and Lily among them.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We're the Findlays. We do whatever they would do.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I think we register. And we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: already made out to Jack Findlay. We are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and there is bedlam at the desk as the busload of Republicans registers. The clerk is eyeing Lily:

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: I'm sorry sir, we have you down for a single. A helpful Republican (MAXWELL) offers:

dialogues.speaker: MAXWELL
dialogues.text: Would you like my double?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No, it's alright. He's already signing the card.

dialogues.speaker: MAXWELL
dialogues.text: It's no bother, really. My wife couldn't make it. My name's Maxwell.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (reading of the registration: ) Jack Findlay.

dialogues.speaker: MAXWELL
dialogues.text: Jack Findlay? That's strange. I know a Jack Findlay. He was supposed to come on this trip.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Oh, that's the other Jack Findlay.  Eddie has seen something outside: P.O.V. A state police car pulls up to the entrance, lights flashing. And another. And another.

dialogues.speaker: MAXWELL
dialogues.text: There's two Jack Findlays?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We're the pro choice Findlays.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He takes Lily by the arm, begins walking her toward the rear of the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Mr. Findlay? Your key: But Eddie and Lily are already running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...out of the back entrance and down through the snow, to the lake where a half dozen ice boats skim along under the brisk wind.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I don't know: They reach the frozen lake just as a man has finished rigging his ice boat for a sail. Eddie turns, sees the cops emerging from the entrance behind him. He shouts at the boater:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Hey: The cops are looking for you!

dialogues.speaker: BOATER
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They're pretty steamed. Shall I hold your boat? The boater watches as the police come running down through the snow, shouting and pointing.

dialogues.speaker: BOATER
dialogues.text: What the hell... Eddie takes the boat as the boater crosses toward the advancing cops. He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: BOATER
dialogues.text: (continued) I can't hear you! And when he turns, he is shocked to see Eddie and Lily on his boat, sailing for the opposite shore.

dialogues.speaker: BOATER
dialogues.text: (continued) Hey! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: on the boat, sailing. The boat is picking up speed, bouncing from side to side. They can barely hold on:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Do you know what you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I sailed a boat once.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: An ice boat?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. Gotta be the same thing, right? The boat nearly tips over, sliding crablike across the slick expanse of ice. Then it spins, loses the wind as

dialogues.speaker: TWO POLICE CARS
dialogues.text: move down the packed snow beside the lodge and onto the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming! Eddie manages to fill the sails, and the boat takes off again.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) Look out! A fishing shanty looms ahead. An ice fisherman emerges, sees the ice boat coming, barely under control, his eyes widening as it WOOSHES past the shanty... ...and spins out of control. Eddie manages to regain the wind and he takes off again, heading back toward the shanty. The fisherman watches dumbfounded as the boat seems bent on attacking ...but Eddie manages to avoid a collision just as one of the police cars comes roaring along the ice, narrowing the distance... ...Eddie swerves, the boat careening on one runner, narrowly missing the police car and the cop hits the brakes, the car doing a spinning 360 and wiping out the shanty in an explosion of boards and fishing tackle.

dialogues.speaker: FISHERMAN
dialogues.text: Goddam sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: are now in the center of the lake, running before the wind, but behind them, the second police car is making headway along the ice, narrowing the distance between them. Lily has to shout to be heard:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I'm freezing!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Me, too. He aims the boat toward the opposite shore line, approaching rapidly, but suddenly A SECOND ICE BOAT barreling along an a perpendicular tack is bearing down on them.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Eddie!  He sees the boat just in time to yank his rudder hard, sending his own boat into a spin and clipping the other boat with a sickening CRAACCCKK!!!...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE'S BOAT
dialogues.text: is missing a runner, now, tipped at an odd angle, sliding toward a snowbank on the far edge of the lake, spinning, grinding a path across the ice with a painful SHRIEK... ...and dumping Eddie and Lily into the snowbank. Silence for a long moment as

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR
dialogues.text: spins it's wheels against the slick ice, making progress toward the wrecked boat and at last

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: rises, takes Eddie by his arm, almost drags him through the snow, away from the lake. And they run. Behind them, the cop in the second car realizes too late he's heading for an ice fisherman's large hole. He pumps his brakes, the nose of the car dips, and then drifts slowly and inevitably into the hole. Up go the back wheels, spinning uselessly in mid air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily run. But the snow is deep and they are exhausted, and the tracks they leave show how impossible it is to keep to a straight line. Lily stumbles, falls. They are both fighting for breath.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Wait... It is a long moment before they can speak.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) This is insane... A sudden CRACK through the trees, a rifle shot, splintering wood near by and the two of them are off again, scrambling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: racing through the trees, a look of terror an her face now. And Eddie calls:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily! He is burrowing into the snow, making a cave. He grabs her, forces her down into the hole, scurries in behind her, then brings a pile of snow down to cover the entrance. Ina flash they are invisible. And we HEAR FOOTSTEPS and HEAVY BREATHING; it is a moment before

dialogues.speaker: TWO HUNTERS
dialogues.text: appear, slogging through the snow, rifles at the ready.

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: You sure it was a buck?

dialogues.speaker: HUNTER
dialogues.text: Hadda be. Big ol' hairy sonofabitch. And as they move an into the woods, WE CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: EDDY AND LILY
dialogues.text: stuffed like rabbits in a cozy hole, their noses inches away, peering into each others' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old-boys club (and now, old-girls, too) at cocktail time: stuffed chairs, deep carpet, white coated waiters serving drinks. A woman (FLORENCE) enters, attractive, about 50, pauses briefly as she searches for someone, then crosses to

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: sitting in an easy chair. He rises with a smile, kisses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I swear you get more beautiful every time I set eyes on you.  She sits.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: Liar. SHANNON. It's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: It's okay, the lie will do.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What are you drinking?

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: The usual. He calls the waiter over:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Bourbon and soda.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: That was a test.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Shame on you.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: I've been reading about you.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I suspect you have.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I need some help, Flo.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: And I thought this was purely social.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I wish it were.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinese physicist by the name of Chen Lu

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: The missing Chen...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: ..and his assistant, Lily Naughton. Collier's been tracking them.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: Collier: Is he involved in this?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I need to find out what he knows.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: He knows everything. He's kissed every important butt in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I've got egg on my face, Flo. I found Chen. I brought him here from China.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can. Be careful of Collier. He won't play with you unless he can keep your balls in a jar by the door. Shannon grins:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I like to take mine with me.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: I wouldn't mind holding them myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nestled in among the trees, boarded up and closed for winter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of BREAKING GLASS, and then a hand reaches in through a broken window and unlocks the door. Eddie and Lily enter. Sheets shroud the furniture, matching the cool white landscape visible through the windows in the moonlight. Lily shivers violently. Eddie grabs a blanket that's being used as a covering for a chair, wraps Lily in it. She's making involuntary sounds, her teeth chattering, her whole body shaking. He rubs her back, puts his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Come on, lie down. She does. Eddie goes down with her, holds her tightly to himself, whispering in her ear:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Shhh... it's okay... you're okay now... She's weeping from cold and fatigue, but gradually her shivering stops...

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Lily has calmed down and warmed up. She lies beside Eddie, wrapped tightly in her blanket. In the dark, they speak in near whispers:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Can we stay here?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: They'll have the dogs and choppers out by daylight. We've got to get to Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It's too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: It's our only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, the fax came from the embassy... whoever's involved in this is in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: He's the only one who can help us.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: You trust him.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I don't trust anyone. I think I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: He's like my dad, Lily. After my dad died, he gave me a job. He made me go back to school. He believed in me.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I hope you're right.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secluded house on a quiet, suburban street. A light burns in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone RINGS on Shannon's nightstand. Shannon picks up:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Tony Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tony, it's Flo. Are you secure?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've checked on Collier for you. He's off the reservation.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence is at a pay phone:

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: I don't know. The Chen story is a fake. Langley was never tracking him. Same with the Naughton woman.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: That's all I have. Silence from Shannon. Then:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Thanks, Flo.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: Be careful. She hangs up. AND WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: sitting an his bed. Rolling his unlit cigar through his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily is asleep on the sofa. A hand reaches down, touches her shoulder gently. She wakens with a start, blinks her eyes open: it's Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sorry... we have to go.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun'll be up in an hour. And WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running lights from a Chevy pick up cut a path through the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Eddie drives, Lily in the seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: How'd you get it started? EDDIE. Everybody knows how to do that in my neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: And gas?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Drained the lawnmower.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: We're criminals, now.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You were sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck emerges from the woods, passes along a bluff with a commanding view of the countryside. EDDIE'S P.O.V. Down the bluff, we can see squad cars parked an the road leading away from the woods: a road block.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I was afraid of that. They'll be all over these woods by sun up. Lily is studying a road map from the glove compartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the lake is that way, there's a freeway this way. They wouldn't block the freeway, would they?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Good point.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I don't see how we get there.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: As the crow flies. He swings the truck around, turns off the road and into a farm lane, and WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky is just light enough to make out the state police cars, unmarked black sedans, and police choppers at the ready. A dozen cops and FBI agents prowl among the vehicles as the choppers rise like giant birds, head toward the wooded area atop the bluff...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck comes bouncing over the field, through the corn stalks, turns down a tractor lane and pulls up to a snow fence separating the farm field from a freeway, just up a short rise on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie puts the truck in gear:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Buckle up. And hold on to your hat. He backs the truck up for a running start, guns the engine, and heads directly for the fence...

dialogues.speaker: FENCE
dialogues.text: closer, closer... and suddenly the fence shatters with the impact of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slipping and sliding now, into the icy ditch that collects the runoff from the rise leading to the freeway. Eddie tries to force his way through, but it's no use, the wheels are spinning against the snow and slush. They are stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choppers are cruising the woods, peering down onto the rooftops of the summer homes, one of which Eddie and Lily have just left. Fresh tire tracks through the newly fallen snow catch the eye of the chopper pilot. He speaks into the radio:

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Chopper one... we've got some tire tracks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is pushing, trying to get the pick up unstuck. Lily is behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Give her some gas! She floors it.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Not so much! Let it rock a little... She tries again. No luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following the tire tracks as they veer off the road and into a farm field.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Chopper one... we got somethin' goin' on here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is straining with all his might. At last, there is movement, the truck inching ahead slowly, along the ditch, and then Lily points it uphill and gives it the gas:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No! No... don't... not so fast. He watches as the truck slips back down the incline, then, miraculously catches hold, spins up the bank and to the crest beside the road. Eddie runs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie opens the door, swings himself in.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Nice work. Lily makes a muscle. She heads for the freeway, slides into the trickle of early morning traffic as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The chopper passes over the fields and hovers above the broken snow fence.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Chopper one... they made it to the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A federal agent stands listening to his radio. He mutters:

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch. And we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: Two poached eggs, beautifully arrayed with a sprig of parsley and a neatly scalloped orange slice. We are in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a fancy hotel restaurant, a jacketed waiter serving Collier his morning fare. Shannon is opposite, coffee.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Why the-bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: No bullshit, Tony. You know everything I do.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: That's the bullshit. That, and the story about Chen. Collier looks up from his eggs.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: What makes you say so?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Let's just say I have my sources.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's just say he's serving a larger purpose. So am I. So are you.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Meaning we're just actors here. We don't know how the play comes out. You might be the villain.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Chen was your boy, Tony. You brought him to the party. You brought in this Kopek kid. You're a suspect. Hell, you even lied to Congress. You said the project was private, no involvement from Langley. Who drinking  do you think would believe you now? Who do you think is going to be responsible if it blows up in our faces?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Except there was no espionage.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: There is now.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I could make a hell of a mess going down, George. Collier studies him for a beat:

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You could.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: That makes me a pretty good villain.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: The truth. Collier pokes his egg, watches the yellow run onto the plate.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck takes the Zanesville exit off the freeway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily still drives, Eddie in the seat beside her.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Can't we just call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phones are tapped for sure. They'll be waiting for us.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: How much money do we have?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I saw something in a movie once. She turns onto the main drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily enters, crosses to the counter. The clerk is an old duffer in a plaid shirt.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I'd like to send some flowers to Washington.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: I'd like to send something to Washington. Wouldn't be flowers.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: May I include a message with that?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: You can if you hold your horses. As the clerk prepares his order form, Lily is suddenly aware of the TV, it's volume tuned low, sitting down the counter:

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER
dialogues.text: New developments in America's biggest manhunt in recent memory - the two suspects being sought  in connection with the Chicago blast eluded police today in a daring getaway...

dialogues.speaker: TV SET
dialogues.text: now showing photos of Eddie and Lily just as

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: enters the shop with a bag of fast food. Lily shoots him a look, nods to the Tv, just as the clerk snaps it off.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Can't hear yourself think with that damn thing yapping at you. Now, who we sending this to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon rides a cargo elevator down, accompanied by two suited men - security personnel. The elevator's open walls reveal a descent through rock and steel girders toa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where the elevator door opens and Shannon emerges. Collier is waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Hello, Tony. This way. He ushers Shannon through a door into a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...modestly appointed board room: a large conference table and chairs, in which Bentley, Coburn and Ryan await his entrance.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. They nod helloes; Shannon sits in the chair provided for him.  Mirthless

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we couldn't have been more open with you from the beginning.., we've pretty much had to proceed on a need to know basis. And until now, we felt you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: BENTLEY
dialogues.text: Tony, before we begin, I'd like to assure you that what you hear today will remain inside these walls.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You mean you won't tell or I won't tell? chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You're right about Dr. Chen, Tony. There was no espionage. Your lab was destroyed on our orders.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: And Bucky?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to say, also on our orders.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We're an interagency team. We advise the president on technology and defense.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Tony, we were in a crisis situation. We had to act quickly. None of us wanted to see Dr. Bucholtz hurt. We had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was going to release the information needed to duplicate his machine on the internet. It would have created chaos. The oil business, the automobile business would have been in turmoil. There would have been financial panic. The relationships on which the world has run for fifty years would have been turned upside- down. We couldn't let it happen.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: So you had him killed.

dialogues.speaker: COBURN
dialogues.text: It was very regrettable, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: And Chen?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We took him. We made him an offer.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: He's here. You can see him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: And Eddie Kopek?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: He and Chen were our cover story. They were simply... how should I put it? Convenient. We were going to throw then to the FBI and let nature take its course.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Nature and some trumped up bullshit from CIA.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: If you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Tony, the story we told you about not being able to make the thing work was true.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Only it's not the Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: That's correct.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You think he's the missing piece of the puzzle?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We hope so. We believe so. He and Miss Naughton.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: And I'm your Judas goat. I lead Eddie to the slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: If he cooperates, there is no slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What if I refuse?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We don't think you can, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: We're in very deep. We're playing for very high stakes.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: That wouldn't be a threat, would it?

dialogues.speaker: BENTLEY
dialogues.text: We've won the cold war, Tony. We're not about to give the trophy back.  The door opens, and a security officer enters:

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: A phone call for Mr. Shannon. Shall I put it through?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Please. The men and women around the table stare curiously at Shannon. And WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon's Washington secretary an the secure phone. She has a box of roses an her lap and a card in her hand:

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: I didn't know whether to bother you or not... it's strange. Shall I read it?... (reading: ) Smithsonian, 5pm. Today. Eddie. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon hangs up. Looks around the room at the others. Slips a cigar out of his coat pocket, rolls it in his fingers, considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie drives, swings into the lane marked Route 70, Washington. He looks over at Lily:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: How come you speak Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I grew up in China. My parents were missionaries.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Missionaries?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everytime I hear the expression "missionary  position: I think of my parents Oing it. She reddens, embarrassed. Then she laughs:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: (continued) God, why did I say that? I'm such a prude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DELIVERYMAN exits from the foundation, crosses to his truck - Dupont Circle Florists stenciled an the side. But before he can enter, two federal agents stop him.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: FBI. Would you come with us, please?

dialogues.speaker: DELIVERYMAN
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black government sedan, a DRIVER in the front seat, Shannon in the rear. From his position, Shannon can see the driver's eye searching the traffic behind him in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Are we being followed?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Shall I try and lose them?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: No. There's a supermarket up on the right a few blocks. Pull in there.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and another agent talk to the OWNER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were sent by phone. I do remember that.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Do you recall where they were sent from?

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: I don't. I'm sorry. It's probably on the receipt. He crosses to his counter, opens a drawer, removes a pile of receipts, begins going through them, slowly, licking his thumb for traction.

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: (continued) Here it is. Zanesville Flower Shop, Zanesville, Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon's car pulls into the lot and stops. Shannon emerges as a second car, another unmarked sedan, pulls into a spot nearby. Shannon crosses to the supermarket entrance. Two agents from the second car follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon enters, takes a shopping cart, drops a few items into it, then crosses to the meat counter. He says to the man behind the counter (BUTCHER):

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I'd like a special cut, I want to speak to the butcher, if you don't mind. He walks quickly to the doors to the rear.

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: I am the butcher. But Shannon is already through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) You wanna talk to the butcher, you gotta talk to me. Can I help you? It's one of the agents who stands before the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon walks quickly through and out the back door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and onto the loading dock, where a van, white, unmarked, awaits. The van pulls to the dock and Shannon enters; the van speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent. Looks at his watch: something fishy. He shows the butcher his badge:

dialogues.speaker: FBI...
dialogues.text: And he crosses to the doors to the rear, enters, leaving the butcher gazing after him. He points to himself:

dialogues.speaker: BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Butcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent emerges onto the dock, looks around. Shannon is nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick up truck pulls into the Lot and stops, Eddie and Lily emerge, cross to the main building. Eddie looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We're a little early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clerk is on the phone:

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Yes, I do remember.... young man, young woman, very nice couple... alright, hold on... He puts the phone down, crosses to his waste basket, pulls out today's paper: Eddie and Lily's photographs on the front page. The clerk returns to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (continued) It's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford is on the phone. He turns to the second agent:

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: They were in Zanesville. (to the phone: ) Do you recall the time?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Earlier today... this morning, it was. Sent a message, too... He scratches his head:

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (continued) No, I can't remember. He holds the phone away from his ear as Ford squawks:

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (continued) Well, now, I am thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far below, Eddie and Lily appear between the massive marble columns and enter the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security guards everywhere. Eddie and Lily walk past the looming dinosaur skeleton and head up the broad stairway to the

dialogues.speaker: SECOND FLOOR
dialogues.text: where they emerge in a long gallery. A line of arched openings overlooks the main hall, and as they move down the colonnade, Eddie spots

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: just entering the building.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: There he is. But as Lily registers her relief, Eddie sees three men who accompany Shannon. They stop, speak for a moment, and then the men fade into the museum, take up positions - apparently as visitors.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: is frozen in his place, incredulous. A long moment before he can say to Lily:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The owner is rummaging through the waste basket, Ford still on the phone beside him:

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: We don't keep records of messages. I might've made notes... He draws a scrap of paper from the basket, reads it:

dialogues.speaker: OWNER
dialogues.text: (continued) This is it...  He hands it to Ford, who scans it quickly, starts moving for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon climbs the stairs to the second floor. He reaches the gallery, sees Eddie, sitting on a bench. Alone. He crosses to him, sits beside him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Hello, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You're safe. Relax.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Who are your friends?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What friends?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: The ones you came with.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I'm here by myself. Where's Lily?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: She never made it.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: She hates Washington. She's probably a thousand miles away by now. Those friends. The men Shannon entered with have moved into the gallery, still trying to blend into the stream of visitors.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: It's complicated, Eddie. I can explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You'll have to come with me.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why don't you explain here?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I can't. Eddie stands.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Eddie, take it easy. But the men, seeing Eddie rise, move quickly. Eddie turns, sprints down the gallery. The three men pursue, as visitors turn, stare at this breach of museum decorum.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie!

dialogues.speaker: PURSUER
dialogues.text: gaining on Eddie. Suddenly, a display comes sliding across the floor into his path, knocking him down. Lily has pushed it.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily, run! She turns, sprints down the gallery as Eddie grabs the club from the hands of "Paleolithic Man", smashes the second pursuer in the face.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARDS
dialogues.text: come running into the gallery, but are swamped by a stream of visitors trying to get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: with two pursuers on their heels, run through a maze of display cases looking for a way out. The door marked "BOTANY" is unlocked and they go through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several workers are startled by the sudden commotion as Eddie and Lily race through, followed seconds later by two pursuers. A researcher grabs a phone and dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford pulls up in his car, a second car behind. Ford and two other agents emerge, cross to the entrance... ...just as Shannon emerges from the museum.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Grab him: Mr. Shannon, I'm going to ask you to wait here.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Are you arresting me? Ford doesn't answer. Without looking back, he enters the museum, leaving Shannon with one of the agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A locomotive, a race car, and a Boeing 727 dominate the Hall of Transportation. Eddie and Lily race into the hall, look around, and head for the nearest stairway.

dialogues.speaker: THREE PURSUERS
dialogues.text: enter behind them, closing the gap, until the stairwell suddenly fills with a group of eighth graders. One of the men breaks off and heads for another stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND LEVEL
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily race down the balcony alongside the Boeing 727. Then Eddie sees the

dialogues.speaker: PURSUER
dialogues.text: who took the other stairway blocking their path. Eddie runs headlong into the man, knocking them both down. But the guy is a brute and he is still blocking the way. Eddie turns, heads the other way.  He looks around for Lily, but she's nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily?! Nothing. The man he knocked down is closing in; the other two are approaching from the other side. Eddie is trapped. Desperate, he leaps up on the 727

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE POD
dialogues.text: then scrambles over the top of the fuselage, past the tail, and slides down the other side onto

dialogues.speaker: THE WING
dialogues.text: suspended high in midair above the hall. Eddie dashes along the wing to the tip and vaults over the railing on the opposite balcony. The men make an end run around the balcony but they're too late. Eddie has vanished. They backtrack to the jetliner, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men enter the airplane, peering behind the seats, into the cockpit. One of the men yanks open the lavatory door: LILY... stands looking out, her face a mask of fear, as the man closes in on her.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Don't touch me! He pins her wrists as she struggles against him. Another of the men appears at her side. He cracks a vial of inhalant under her nose. She goes limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie dashes into the darkened

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the middle of a full alert.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: (from speaker: ) Stand by to launch aircraft. Eddie melts into the shadows and glances around. It looks like he's lost his pursuers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and two agents are surrounded by a half dozen workers, all of them shouting different directions:

dialogues.speaker: WORKERS
dialogues.text: There were four of them... they went through there... no, that way... there were only two of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is moving along the ground floor corridor with a mob of tourists, looking around frantically for Lily and trying to stay invisible. Suddenly, he stops in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie sees Lily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three men support Lily as she stumbles along with them, half conscious. They lead her to a white van...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...as Eddie slams his fist against the glass in frustration. He spots an exit at the end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie comes running out and down the broad steps. The van is moving away. Eddie runs after it, catching sight of something scrawled in the dust on the back: Leesburg Construction hires scab.... ...but as Eddie gets almost close enough to touch the rear, door, the van pulls away. He stops, out of breath. Not far away, Eddie sees security guards moving in. He turns, dashes back down a ramp leading to door under the museum. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie runs down the long tunnel, footsteps echoing in the emptiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford emerges from inside, crosses down the steps to Shannon and the agent he was left with.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: Better get yourself a lawyer, Mr. Shannon. I'm gonna bust your ass. And Ford continues on down the steps as WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door marked "No Public Access" opens a crack. Eddie peeks out. He steps into the marble hallway, gently closes the door behind him. He has no idea where he is. He eases into another tour group.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: ...and at the end of this hall we will see the Capitol Building rotunda where the bodies of Presidents Lincoln and John F. Kennedy lay in state...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie emerges:

dialogues.speaker: CAPITOL MALL, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: the bronze statues of generals on horseback are dusted with snow and the Washington Monument stands stark white against the crisp winter sky. All around, American flags snap smartly in the breeze. Eddie pulls up his collar and descends the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie walks. He seems aimless, his mood dark. He hunches his shoulders against the wind and cold, his eyes an the pavement in front of him. Newspapers at a kiosk sport headlines:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign says "Full Chinese Meal - $2". Eddie peers in through the frosted window, reaches into his pocket. He pulls out a handful of change - not nearly enough. He continues on. Down the sidewalk, a homeless man (LARRY) is panhandling.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Pardon me, sir. Spare some change? Eddie doesn't even look up.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) That's right. Don't even look. Eddie continues on. Larry has to call after him:

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) Nobody looks at the homeless. Another few steps, and then Eddie stops, turns, stares a Larry.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) Hey! Con...TACT! Larry salutes:

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) Yes... SIR! Lawrence Applewhite, ready for duty, SIR! And WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of destitute men and women snakes through a dingy church basement, where volunteers serve soup and sandwiches. Eddie and Larry are among them, only Eddie is wearing Larry's clothes and Larry has on Eddie's tweeds. Somehow, Eddie looks right at home among these people, and in Eddie's clothes, Larry looks like visiting royalty.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Thank you sister... set my man up here with whatever he needs... thank you brother... Hey! One dinky ol1' baloney sandwich for my man? Shame on you! He's a growin' boy. The volunteer dumps another limp baloney sandwich on Eddie's plate.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) You want that? Eddie puts the sandwich on Larry's plate.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) Thank you, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat up Dodge Dart, circa 1968. The back seat is filled with the odds and ends of Larry's existence. And at the moment, it is also filled with Eddie, huddled under a blanket. Larry is in the front seat, huddled under his own blanket.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Can't sleep in them shelters, bro. Very low class of people in there. Steal your goddam teeth if you open your mouth to snore.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Where's Leesburg?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Leesburg? Only Leesburg I know is in Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Your car make it that far?

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Hell, yes. Suddenly, a light flashes inside the car, illuminating first Larry's face.

dialogues.speaker: A COP
dialogues.text: stands beside the car, pointing his flashlight at the occupants. CoP Can't park it here, boys.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, SIR! We'll move it, SIR! The cop shines his light on Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Right away, SIR! The cop douses his light, walks away, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continued) Ass...HOLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glorious day; the Capitol Building stands proudly against a blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small office adjacent to a committee room. Shannon scans a printed statement; Collier sits nearby.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Who wrote it?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: It's nice to know who's mouthpiece I am.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You're-investing in your future, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Well, let's see. You've killed a man, blown up his lab and walked away without his secret, and you can't put your hands on a kid who's running around out there without a clue. You want me to trust in such competence?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Just read it, Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Senate committee hearing: a panel of Senators listens as Shannon reads:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: We don't know the cause of the explosion, it's true. We don't  know the source of the espionage, if indeed there was espionage. But we know that we are at risk. Every idea that offers a competitive advantage for Americans is subject to theft. And that is the lesson to be drawn from this disaster. Security concerns must be paramount. We must begin to treat business secrets the way we once treated military ones. The cold war may be over, but we are still at war.

dialogues.speaker: SENATOR
dialogues.text: Mr. Shannon, yours are the words of a patriot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A yard brimming with trucks, vans, and at the far end, a small office. Larry's car pulls in and parks, and Larry and Eddie emerge, head for the office.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: I'd give my left nut for a job, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tough looking FOREMAN is giving Eddie and Larry a disapproving look over:

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: No jobs. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Man, how about a little temporary work? Just a little something...

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. You'd need security clearances anyway.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Security? What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All our guys need clearances. Tell your friend he oughta start with a bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Larry are parked outside the construction yard.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Man said no. wasting time.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Never know. Let's where they go.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: You da boss. Larry pulls out behind a row construction yard, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trucks pull off the road a large "No Admittance" sign pulls up and stops along the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Larry watch as the gate area.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Well, what's your idea, I think you're just see of trucks as they leave the and into a fenced area with posted on the gate. Larry road. trucks disappear into the bro? A sharp RAP on the window startles them both:

dialogues.speaker: AN ARMED GUARD
dialogues.text: has come up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Looking for work. Larry rolls down his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't park here. They're hiring down at the Leesburg yard.

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, SIR! Right away, SIR! And Larry swings around, heads back down the road. A NOISY line of flatbed trucks, hauling huge construction pipes and heading for the gate, makes Larry shout as he concentrates on not getting sideswiped:

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) Ain't that the usual bitch? Ain't hiring here, they're hiring over there. And then you get there and they tell you no, it's the last place, and now you Lost your place in line at the last place... And he turns to Eddie, discovers the car door open and Eddie nowhere in sight..

dialogues.speaker: LARRY
dialogues.text: (continued) What in the goddam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line of trucks enters the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A truck pulls to a halt beside the other trucks, near some construction sheds. The driver crosses to a shed, and once he passes, Eddie pokes his head out of a construction pipe, then leaps out. He sees a group of construction workers coming out of one of the sheds, wearing jackets and hard hats, and he makes his way to the door, enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slickers and hard hats hang on pegs; Eddie dresses. Ona wall is a set of blueprints detailing the construction  site; Eddie takes it down, rolls it up, stuffs it under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie falls in with a group of workers, heading toward a cargo elevator. As he goes, he notices that each of them has a security identification badge. He looks down at his own slicker: no badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workers wait as a group of men exit the elevator, apparently a shift change. Eddie awkwardly bumps into one of the departing men:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Excuse me. Eddie has his badge. He pins it to his slicker and the group enters the elevator cage. The elevator begins its descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator cage reaches bottom and the men exit. Eddie sneaks a look at a conveyor belt hauling rocks and earth upward. The group moves down the tunnel to a truck. They climb on and the truck and it heads down the long tube.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: The men are walking again, past a huge hydraulic machine. Eddie stops, looks it over, then unscrolls the blueprints under his arm, tries to orient himself. When he rolls the blueprints up again, the group has moved off, and he is alone. He heads the other way.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Eddie comes to a huge door, blocking his progress. He crosses to a ladder at the side of the door, climbs it, where it gives way to a vent pipe. Eddie moves from the ladder to the pipe and crawls through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie slips through the narrow pipe with some effort. Ahead, a shaft of light suggests an opening. He crawls... AND WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a massive array of computers, run by a staff of technicians. Just off the main room, there is a small

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE
dialogues.text: with a large window looking onto the main computer area. Sitting before a small group of scientists is Lily.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: We've been following your work for some time. We're very impressed.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to be flattered?

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: We'd like to check some figures with you, if you don't mind.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Miss Naughton, we can offer you a chance to continue the work you've been doing with Dr. Chen.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Where is Dr. Chen?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: I'm afraid he's not available. He's quite ill.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Then let me speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: We'd have to get clearance for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Call me when you do.

dialogues.speaker: PUMP ROOM
dialogues.text: Eddie emerges from the vent pipe into a pump room - a huge pumping station supplying the entire complex. Several smaller tunnels lead off of this room; Eddie opens a door to one of them, peers down: P.O.V. at the end of the tunnel, he can see workers moving past an opening. They are lab personnel, dressed in casual clothes. Eddie removes his slicker and hard hat, then enters the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: SMALLER TUNNEL
dialogues.text: with cables running the length: Eddie moves through the tunnel as the CAMERA MOVES with him along the length of cable and we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily is being led by a security GUARD along a corridor to a

dialogues.speaker: ROOM
dialogues.text: which she enters. It is minimally furnished with a bed and desk and nothing else; a door leads to a small bathroom. She turns to the guard:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Sorry. I'd ask you in but the place is a mess.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Yes, Ma'am. She closes the door in his face. AND WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: where the tunnel ends and a series of corridors lead in different directions. Eddie enters from the tunnel; he chooses a corridor and moves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near the ceiling, a surveillance camera catches Eddie unaware. We CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of screens with odd, infra red images. One of the screens reveals Eddie as he moves down the corridor - an infra red picture of him that intermittently flashes a warning sign: UNIDENTIFIED. A security OFFICER checking the screens picks up a phone:

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: We have an unregistered party in corridor thirty four.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Eddie moves past doors announcing various research projects. Through the window he can see a Saudi Prince with a robed entourage playing with a deadly contraption.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY OFFICERS
dialogues.text: move down another corridor, checking in rooms as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: rounds a corner, then stops. He is stupefied. He is standing in the midst of a duplicate of the lab in Chicago. It is a stunning sight. Technicians move about, checking equipment. Eddie hears something behind him. He wheels, finds a half dozen armed security guards, their weapons pointing at him.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Put your hands over your head. Don't move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A war room: a world map - a mosaic of real-time satellite images - dominates rows of empty desks and  consoles. Eddie sits under the watchful eye of a pair of guards. The door opens, and Shannon enters. He nods to the guards, and they exit, leaving Shannon and Eddie alone.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Hello, Eddie. You did well.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Where's Lily?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll see her. You hungry? Want something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: No. Shannon crosses to him, sits.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: How much have you figured out?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Only that you're a liar.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Partly true. The money for the lab was coming from the CIA. I couldn't be honest about it, because we'd never have gotten Bucky if he knew. I'm under contract to them. I was reporting our progress. I had no idea they'd killed Bucky, and no idea that they'd blown up the lab.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: They planted the money on me?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were just an accident. If you hadn't gone back to the lab and discovered Bucky, you might have been left alone.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: And Chen?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: They needed a cover story. He was convenient.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why did they kill Bucky?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: He's was going to make his discovery public. It's why they blew up the lab.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: But they had a duplicate lab.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: From your information.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What'll they do with Bucky's invention?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Develop it. Make sure American companies are ready for it. Make sure they can profit from it. Eddie shakes his head:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Bucky was going to give it away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the way the world works, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: The world works the way we make it work! Everything else is bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: The world is full of fear. Full of greed. It's full of people struggling for an advantage. You still have to live in it.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: And how do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You make compromises. You make choices. Sometimes it's not between good and bad, it's between bad and worse. But you still choose.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You lied to him. You betrayed him, and now you're just looking to justify it.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: His way isn't the only way, Eddie. Bucky was a dreamer. He had a great way with college kids, that's what he was good at. Eddie explodes: Pause; he

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Then what are you good at? Shannon. I trusted you! I believed in you! I made Lily trust you! looks as if he might weep:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Where is she? I want to see her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, I'm going to offer you both a choice. They need your help. To make Bucky's invention work. You and Lily.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: They can't get it to work?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: No. Dumb motherfuckers is what Eddie thinks. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: What if I say no? The doors suddenly swing open, and Collier enters, crossing to Eddie and Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: If you say no, Eddie, you'll miss a chance at history. You'll miss a chance at one of the great discoveries of the modern age. You'll miss a chance at a long and prosperous life. You and Lily. Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small conference room, a few chairs and a table, where Lily sits. The door opens: Eddie stands in the corridor with an armed guard. Lily's eyes widen with relief, then fill with tears. She draws him in, closes the door behind him, embraces him tightly. Before he can speak, she puts a finger to his lips, takes a pen and writes on the

dialogues.speaker: PALM OF HER HAND
dialogues.text: a single word: "bugged." Eddie takes the pen, writes on

dialogues.speaker: HIS OWN PALM
dialogues.text: "Don't trust them." She embraces him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily are accompanied by Shannon and a small group of scientists and technicians.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: We understand the function of the catalyst and the laser application, which makes the reaction self sustaining. But we can't seem to control it, and this makes the process highly dangerous. We think the nozzle you've built is what makes it controllable. But for some reason, we don't have the specs for the nozzle, and we can't seem to duplicate your work.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I want to see Chen. I can't do it without Chen. The scientist nods, then casts a glance at Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, Lily, Shannon and a pair of armed guards move down a long corridor into an area marked "Hospital".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ward is equipped with two dozen beds, ready for the disasters envisioned by Cold War planners. At the far end, a single bed is occupied and attended by a NURSE. Eddie, Lily, Shannon and the guards enter and cross to the occupied bed.

dialogues.speaker: CHEN
dialogues.text: lies on the bed, his breathing aided by a an automatic respirator, its mechanical INHALE and EXHALE EERILY LOUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is he today?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: No change. Lily takes Chen's hand in her own. It is nearly imperceptible, but we can SEE Chen's hand squeeze Lily's, twice.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
