dialogues.text: Can we be alone with him? Just for a minute? Shannon considers. At last, he nods to the guards, and he, the nurse and the guards exit, leaving Lily and Eddie alone with Chen. Eddie makes a rapid inspection of the bed, the walls, the medicine cart nearby - no bugs. But he sees Chen's free hand moving feebly along the bed to a spot near his pillow. Eddie lifts the mattress just far enough. There's the bug. And WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security officer listens and as WE MOVE IN ON HIS EARPHONES, WE HEAR the SOUND of Chen's respirator, a deep, rasping inhale and exhale and WE CUT TO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Chen's bedside, only it's not Chen's breathing but Eddie forcing air from an inflated hot water bottle to simulate the raspy sound for the hidden bug as Lily bends over Chen and listens to Chen's whispered words. And as WE MOVE IN, we can HEAR them too: they're in Chinese. She turns to Eddie, searching his eyes out with her own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily emerges from the ward, crosses to Shannon, waiting with the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards. Get him to a real hospital and we'll help you. Shannon peers into the hospital ward at Eddie, sitting with Chen, holding onto his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. And we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine shop is outfitted in a way that makes Eddie's Chicago shop seem amateurish. Eddie pokes through the various materials, neatly stored on shelves as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hospital personnel place Chen on a gurney and wheel him to the corridor and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily moves through the lab with Shannon, Collier and a small group of scientists:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: The laser timing?

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Computer controlled, using your data.

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: And auxiliary power?

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Automatically, in the event of main source failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're using discarded data here.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Can you update?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is at the lathe, turning his nozzle, shaping it carefully. Two scientists watch over his shoulder as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chen's gurney is loaded onto the elevator and it begins it's ascent as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie inserts the plunger into the nozzle and checks its play: He passes the nozzle to the scientists, and while they inspect it, we see Eddie slip a metal cylinder into his pocket. And we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily enters new data into the computers under the watchful eye of scientists and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the elevator door opens and the hospital personnel wheel Chen's gurney to a waiting ambulance and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie squirms under the water tank, placing the nozzle in it's appropriate housing as Shannon, Collier and the scientists observe. He removes the old housing, places it on the floor beside him, and as Shannon and Collier  study the new nozzle in place, we see that the old housing has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scientists and technicians sit at a long table, eating their cafeteria fare. At the far end of the table, Eddie and Lily sit side by side. As always, Lily's head is bent over a computer print out, which she is checking with her pencil, making notes on the margins.

dialogues.speaker: PRINTOUT
dialogues.text: In the middle of her technical comments, she has scrawled a note: "reprog okay".

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: nods, he's seen it. She overwrites the note with a series of figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are out, save for a few work lights that cast eerie shadows over the equipment. Standing in the half dark is Shannon. Thinking. He crosses to the water tank, peers down at the nozzle, newly installed. He runs his hand over it, but there's no way that he can judge it's construction. There's also no way that he can ignore his suspicions.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE AREA
dialogues.text: Shannon is reading through a stack of computer print outs, much like the ones we've seen Lily with. He sits back in his chair, rubs his eyes. Then he notices a the wastebasket nearby, filled with print outs. Idly, he pokes through them.

dialogues.speaker: PRINTOUTS
dialogues.text: Lily's figuring on the margins. Something draws his eye to one of the sheets: it's the note Lily has scrawled, still legible through her overwriting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon is watching as the computer spits out a series of pages. He gathers a stack of them, sits down at a desk and begins comparing a set of sheets with another set already on the desk. He reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon is in the lab, rolling his cigar back and forth in his fingers. The door opens, and Eddie is led in by a guard. Shannon nods to the guard.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Thank you. The guard exits, leaving Eddie and Shannon alone among the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You'll never get away with it.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: with what? He motions to a pile of computer printouts he has in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I'm sure it's clever. I'm sure it uses Lily's help.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I don't know either, exactly. They're not fools, you know. They'll figure it out. Why don't you tell me what it is?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Why don't you figure it out?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Are you that brave, Eddie? Are you willing to risk that much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose we make it work. What happens to us then?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: They'll give you a new life. Another name, another country, if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You believe that?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: They're not monsters. They're just caught in a bad spot.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: They've killed Bucky! They destroyed his dream. It was my dream, too. What good would it do to get a new life if I had to be a part of that?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You have a lot to live for, Eddie. You're like a son to me. I never had a family, so I made one up. You and Chen and Lily, everyone at the lab. And Bucky, like a crazy old uncle.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You threw it away. Don't you understand? You threw it away!

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You don't always get what you want.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You lied! You want me to do the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I want you to understand. I wish I could make you.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: You already have.  And their eyes meet and hold. Shannon's seem to harbor a deep sadness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers emerge from the elevator as the next shift prepares to descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collier, Shannon, and a group of scientists cluster together as the technicians busy themselves with a test. Not far away are Eddie and Lily.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Main power. The odd hum of machinery again. In the tank, small bubbles appear at the edges of the electrodes.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: (continued) Injector...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: move, as if by instinct, closer to one another. Eddie slips his hand around Lily's; their fingers tighten together, then intertwine. A BELL RINGS as

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTISTS AND TECHNICIANS
dialogues.text: slip dark glasses over their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Laser... The laser glows, bouncing its beams off the mirrors. The water tank begins to shudder as the water roils.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: (continued) Cavitation sound waves... A Technician at the console moves a control forward and the

dialogues.speaker: NOZZLE
dialogues.text: hums, turning the water blue.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON AND COLLIER
dialogues.text: cross to the tank, watch, expectantly, as the shuddering continues. A long moment as Collier peers down at the nozzle. He turns to Shannon, consternation growing.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Wait. He's seen this before. He turns to Eddie, stares hard at him, then back to the tank, which is shuddering dangerously now. And Shannon knows:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Shut it down.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: draws the main power switch to its off position. The hum of machinery dies. In the silence that follows, Shannon turns to Eddie again:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie... But before he can add another word, the hum suddenly returns, and the roiling of water in the tank increases.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Shut it down!

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: It is down! He maneuvers the master switch, but the hum and the shuddering in the tank seem to grow.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: (continued) It's not responding!

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie! But Eddie is already moving, toward Collier, something in his hand, shiny, metallic...  He grabs Collier, holds the object to Collier's temple and now we can see what it is-a crudely shaped, lethal looking pistol, fashioned from spare parts in the machine shop.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Pull the alarm! No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Pull the alarm! He cocks the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Do what he says: A technician crosses to the emergency alarm, pulls the switch. A loud WAILING SIREN suddenly adds its noise to the shuddering tank.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Get these people out of here. Clear the tunnel!

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Do it! All of you! The scientists and technicians head for the doors.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily...

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Eddie, no...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Time to go, Lily. Get out.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: It won't work, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to take a chance? He points the pistol at Shannon.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: He's bluffing. I don't think he has any ammunition in that thing. Eddie returns the pistol to Collier's temple.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Shall we demonstrate?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Tony, for Christ sake! Shannon reaches into his coat, draws out a small automatic pistol. He crosses to Lily, hold the gun to her.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Let's see what's real here.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Shoot, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: On three, Eddie. One... two...

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Shannon; goddamit

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Last call, Eddie. Eddie drops his pistol to the floor. Collier lets out a long breath, mops the sweat from his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make him shut the damn thing down.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: How do we do it, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Guess.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I've already guessed. You're using auxiliary power. Lily, isn't that right? You reprogrammed the computer so that when the main power was shut down, it would read as a power failure. Very smart. So all we have to do is shut down the back up!

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter what you do. This whole thing is worthless, anyway. You might as well let it blow.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Why, Lily?

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Because Bucky was smarter than all of you. He knew someone was Stealing his information, so he kept part of the data secret. Not even Chen knew what it was. The stuff you were sending to this lab had a missing element, and only Bucky knew it. And you killed him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: The goose that laid the golden egg. What about it, George?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: I think they're lying.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Not this time.  Collier crosses to a phone.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: I'm getting the power shut down.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: What do you mean? He looks up to find Shannon's pistol pointed at him.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Get out, Eddie. Lily.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Are you mad?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie, do me a favor. Pick up that phone and call 911. Tell them you want Agent Ford from the FBI here.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Tony, don't be stupid...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Shut up, George. Go on, Eddie, make the call.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We can all get out...

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Make the call! Eddie crosses to the phone, dials:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: We've got an emergency here. We'd like you to get Agent Raymond Ford from the FBI...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Shannon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, Eddie. Now go. No mistaking his intent; Eddie grabs Lily by the hand and they run. Shannon crosses to the hydrogen holding tank still holding his pistol on Collier. He opens the valve, and deadly hydrogen gas spills into the lab with a loud HISS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily burst through the doors to the lab and head for the elevator. But rounding a corner and looking up, they see the

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: loaded with lab and security personnel, ascending to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: This way! They turn, race down the tunnel as

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARDS
dialogues.text: from the lab area recognize Eddie and Lily:

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Don't let them get away! They chase, one of the guards barking into his radio

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF TUNNEL
dialogues.text: ...asS Eddie and Lily reach a concrete form: they are blocked by another pair of guards. Eddie grabs Lily's hand, leads her down a narrow space between the wall and the concrete form, barely wide enough for them pass.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: Inch their way forward. It's a tight, claustrophobic squeeze, and Lily has to fight her panic.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Hold on... hold on... He gives her his hand, tries to reassure her as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: follows them into the space, a short way behind.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Another guard, seeing Eddie and Lily behind the form, throws the compression controls; the hydraulic arm starts to move and the form closes to the walls as

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: can barely edge forward, the space growing smaller and smaller, the stuff of nightmares:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Eddie! I can't... And at the last moment, Eddie clears the form, pulling Lily with him. They leap down to the tunnel floor as

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD
dialogues.text: following them through the narrow space is crushed, his blood seeping down the wall below like an ugly paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon holds Collier at bay with his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Well, George, we're in a real pickle, aren't we? If I shoot, you're dead. But the shot would set this whole place off, so I'm dead, too. What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: I don't know, Tony. Why don't you put the gun down?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: It's sort of like the arms race, isn't it? What was the phrase? Mutually Assured Destruction?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Yes, that's it.  Collier is sweating profusely.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: What do you say we negotiate?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Yes, that's fine. That's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: We'll both make a full confession of how we happen to be here. You write how it was that Bucky died. I'll write how it was I've been lying to Congress. Then we'll exchange confessions. I'll have yours and you'll have mine. That way, we'll each be protected if the other decides to go to the FBI. Is that fair?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Tony, I'm going to turn around and walk out of here. You, won't shoot. Shannon cocks the pistol, loudly.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Are you certain? Collier finds himself staring down the barrel of the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: You are mad. Shannon places his pen on the table between them.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: We have some paper here, don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily race toward the conveyor belt, carrying crushed rock upward from the tunnel to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on it: She turns to him as if he's crazy:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: (continued) Lily, get on! And he practically has to put her on it himself, before leaping on behind her.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: chasing the two of them race past the conveyor belt and on down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: CONVEYOR BELT
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily ride the belt. Lily, ahead, looks forward, sees that the rocks are being carried toward a compressor. She turns, shouts:

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: Eddie! And now, Eddie sees it too. He turns, looks behind him: a guard has seen him on the belt. He jumps on, begins moving up the belt toward Eddie and Lily. As he closes in, Eddie notices a pipe stretching across the conveyor belt:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Grab onto the pipe! LILY turns, she is closing on the pipe:

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Lily! Can she do it? She reaches out, grabs for the pipe, but her hand slips off. The belt carries her just beyond and she turns and tries again - this time, she manages to hold on: Behind her, Eddie approaches the pipe. He reaches for it and the two of them now hang side by side as

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD
dialogues.text: riding the belt behind them approaches, trying to aim hi weapon at them. But the belt is unsteady and he can't quite manage as he draws closer and closer and

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: holding onto the pipe, swings his boot at the guard, catching him flush on the jaw and the guard goes down onto the conveyor belt and is carried up toward the compressor as

dialogues.speaker: LILY
dialogues.text: watches, over her shoulder, finally turns away, can't bear to look as the guard is... compressed.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: make their way, hand over hand, away from the moving belt until they are clear and can jump down onto the tunnel floor. They run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collier is finished writing. He puts Shannon's pen down. Shannon picks up the paper and reads. And while he reads, he chats:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: You love science, George?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Very much. Yes. He speaks to Shannon as if Shannon has lost his mind.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: So do I. We could have been famous. One of the great discoveries of the modern age, indeed. It's not enough, is it?

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: What isn't enough?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Science, George. It doesn't make us better people. This is excellent.  The HISS of the hydrogen leak seems like a howl now. The water tank shudders with such force that a metal tipped strap breaks loose, slams with great force against the floor, again and again.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) That looks very dangerous. Shannon folds the paper neatly, puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Bucky was right, wasn't he? We need new ways of being human.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to write your confession?

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Actually, I've change my mind. And as Collier watches with growing alarm, Shannon coolly rises and crosses toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Shannon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Lily emerge from the tunnel into the daylight. The RADIATION ALARM is still screaming as lab personnel and construction workers scramble for safety. Eddie and Lily join in the throng, running for the perimeter of the site as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Ford pulls up in his car and stops, gets out and watches agape as the mob runs toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shannon runs for the huge submarine doors, now open at the end of the tunnel. Behind him, Collier chases:

dialogues.speaker: COLLIER
dialogues.text: Shannon, for god's sake...  Shannon leaps through the doors, turns, manages to stare into Collier's frantic eyes just before he slams the huge doors shut. He grabs some construction rods piled by the doors, inserts them through the door handles so that they bar the door from opening.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER SIDE OF THE DOORS
dialogues.text: Collier frantically presses the automatic controls, trying to open the doors. They shudder, but the force of the construction bars is too strong and the doors don't open. Collier races for the lab.

dialogues.speaker: DUPLICATE LAB
dialogues.text: as Collier enters. The loosened strap is banging with incredible force now and it makes Collier stop in his tracks. He's agonized, doesn't know where to turn. At last, he crosses to the strap, hoping to grab it and prevent it from striking a surface when his eyes widen in horror and the

dialogues.speaker: STRAP
dialogues.text: bangs against the metal form of the water tank and the tiniest spark flies into the thickening air and WE CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers streaming out of the site, onto the road, in pickup trucks, on foot, Lily and Eddie among them and as Ford sees them, the ground beneath them suddenly shudders and WE CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a giant sinkhole is created from the explosion below, dust and debris rising as after a powerful earthquake and

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE AND LILY
dialogues.text: can only hold onto each other in the confusion and hysteria that follows as they make their way across the rumbling earth to Agent Ford and safety... And we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: BLAST
dialogues.text: And finally, a smaller Story:

dialogues.speaker: BLAST SURVIVORS BACK AT WORK, HOPE TO RESUME FUEL PROJECT
dialogues.text: A photo of Eddie and Lily DISSOLVES TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modestly appointed sloop afloat on what must be the blue green waters of the Caribbean. In the rear of the boat is a figure in a captain's hat and white ducks, feet up on the rail, writing on a small steno pad. It's Shannon, and we HEAR HIM, VOICE OVER:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: Eddie... delighted to read of your return to work. Hope all is well. I'11l be in touch. Tony. He calls into the cabin:

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Where's my first mate? Florence appears carrying two drinks. He slips his arm around her waist, hands her the paper from the Steno pad.

dialogues.speaker: SHANNON
dialogues.text: (continued) Send this when we reach port.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: Send it yourself, you big lug.  She hands him his drink and kisses him lightly, on the lips. And they settle in for the sunset. END CREDITS.
